lorebooks.description: reaper stuff
lorebooks.creator: portatochisps

1.content:
From whatâ€™s told and implied in the Intermission, Reapers are evolved from plants, more specifically flowers, explaining why their bodies primarily consist of roots and no (known) organs or blood like humans.
They have â€œskinâ€ to fit in and take on a much more human-like appearance, but it can dissipate inadvertently under high enough emotional stress, primarily shown with Lloyd, showing that underneath their â€œskinâ€ they are primarily black roots tangled to take on a roughly human-esque appearance, with the only discernable features being the eyes, and finger-like extensions from the hands made from the same tangled roots.

Despite this, their roots can manifest externally, such as in Chapter 2 when Mary turns her lollipop into a scythe. Another example is back in late Chapter 5, during the battle with Arthur where they extend from her palm to grab her lost lollipop.
They are also seemingly strong enough to function as efficient limbs en masse, as Arthurâ€™s are strong enough to carry him as fast as human running speed when chasing Felix in Chapter 4.

Additionally, in Chapter 6, it appears that whoever the roots belong to, even if grown outside sources, such as from within the hospital can be controlled by their original creator, as Mary was able to gag Arthur with the roots while lowering him down to ground from the hospital window.

2.content:
By their floral origin, Reapers are generally made up of a â€œbouquetâ€ of four different flowers: some flowers may be associated as good or bad depending on the type, though whether these are correlated to their real life equivalentsâ€™ toxicity are unknown. Additionally, whether these flowersâ€™ presence/absence actually affects a Reaperâ€™s moral compass has yet to be confirmed, and so thereâ€™s the possibility this may simply be common prejudice against these flowers, and that the only toxic individual actually shown to spawn from these flowers, Mary, may be by coincidence, albeit no evidence supports this claim of coincidence.

The only known Reaper Bouquet is Marylinâ€™s, whose consists of Belladonna, Brugmansia, Henbane, and Datura, all of which are toxic flowers.

3.content:
Evidenced by Mary mid-Chapter 3, Reapers can create â€˜treesâ€™ consisting primarily of their roots tangled to resemble a leafless tree, although what purpose a Tree serves for a Reaper is unexplained, although they do appear to carry apparitions of the souls that a Reaper has collected on their â€˜branchesâ€™. In Maryâ€™s case, her own Tree was presumably created from the roots of her own body, though whether itâ€™s necessary to create a Tree this way is unknown.

Trees may grow their own flowers and leaves using their roots, presumably the Bouquet of the individual that created it by default; which can grow up many, many times larger than actual plants, as shown by Maryâ€™s Tree left at the secret club in the Malltel. They also can seemingly grow much faster than any normal plant, as the aforementioned Malltell Tree by Mary grew to the point of partially covering the Malltellâ€™s exterior in a matter of hours, when previously, when it was first created, it took up the center of the main club area.

Multiple Trees from the same individual can exist at once, as Maryâ€™s two Trees in the story so far, one at the Malltell, and the other much more recently left at the park she and Felix fought Arthur in, had seemingly no issues existing at once.

Trees appear to have adverse effects on both humans and other Reapers, with the exception of the Reaper who created it, though what these effects are is unspecified and unclear.

4.content:
Reapers age physically by either Reaping or eating souls: Reaping allows slow but gradual aging, while eating souls accelerates the aging process, but at the risk of being regurgitated under certain conditions due to souls being unable to die, and thus remaining permanently â€˜digestingâ€™ in their body. Regurgitation of souls can be caused by things such as the individualâ€™s body holding too many at once, or being forced out of them, both exemplified by Mary in Chapters 2 and 4 respectively.

Whether things such as age-related laws apply to a Reaper based on physical or chronological age is unknown.
Additionally, rarely, Reapers may go through a malformed adolescent age, such as Arthur.

Reapers can regrow limbs, although they may vary and may not regrow in consistent forms and may vary in what form they might take.

According to Lloyd, Reapers may or may not be able to reproduce asexually, although this could also be an excuse for his currently single marital status.(as itâ€™s implied that Maryâ€™s mother was previously present but left)
Depending on whether if his words are to be taken as fact, this introduces two possibilities:

Lloyd was lying to excuse his marital status, and Reapers may be unable to reproduce asexually, and sexual reproduction is mandatory.(Maybe pollination, like real world flowers? Sex makes no sense considering their biology)
Lloyd was using fact to excuse his marital status, and Reapers can reproduce asexually, but also sexually if they so choose.

5.content:
Reapers also go through a stage of pupation, turning into a cluster of roots resembling an coccoon, with features possibly hinting at their adolescent form, like with Mary.
Despite this, Reapers are not completely helpless during pupation, as they appear to retain some form of consciousness and abilities, such as being able to move and manipulate the roots making up their egg. This is especially exemplified by Mary, who was able to speak coherently and even call out to Felix playfully shortly after being forced to return to pupation after the battle with Arthur. She also seemed to retain enough intelligence to wait until a daycare worker turned their back to kill them and claim their soul in Chapter 6, implying that a Reaperâ€™s consciousness, and possibly even senses might be retained during pupation.

Despite this, a Reaperâ€™s form may differ for each hatching, such as Mary taking on an entirely different form from her human-like body after hatching for (presumably) the second time in the daycare.
They also appear to hatch with their weapon (i.e. Maryâ€™s lollipop) already with them.

6.content:
Souls in Deathsitter are depicted as color-tinted eggs: the shells and white are both tinted a specific color, and the yolk takes on the primary hue. The whites themselves are also transparent, and have long, wispy â€œtailsâ€.
Generally in humans, the Soul is located in a specific location in the body, whether the leg, arm, chest, head, or elsewhere. They can be extracted by Reapers, and seemingly only touched by Reapers, as the Arthur Clone reacts with â€œHow can you hold that?â€ when Felix physically takes his Soul back.
Souls also appear floating alongside a Reaperâ€™s Tree as apparitions, with the shells broken and the yolk exposed.
When being regurgitated by a Reaper, only the yolk and white are spat out, with the shell seemingly disappearing. The Soul itself flies away, though where they go is unknown.

Souls, depending on what is done with them, can affect the dead body of their original owner, resulting in Recomposition if left unreaped. Eating a Soul seems to be separate from Reaping one, as the owners of the Souls Mary have eaten, or rather, their corpses, Recompose. This is seemingly due to Souls simply remaining inside a Reaperâ€™s body when eaten, left eternally â€œdigestingâ€ because Souls cannot be destroyed.

1.content:
Adoption system
Adoption system is regulated by law. To adopt someone, they will be required to attend the court together and register willingly in front of an officer. Adopted person will have the same rank but they will have the rights of one rank below their adopter. For example, if an A rank adopt a D rank, the adopted D rank will have the rights of B rank although their rank is still D. The adopted person will maintain this rights as long as they are adopted. If the adopter decided to unregister, the adopted will revert back to their original rights. This create a power dynamics where the adopted will try their absolute best to please their adopter.

Marriage
A married person will have their rights upgraded to the highest ranked person. For example, an A rank woman married to a C rank man. The C rank man will have an A rank rights. Same sex marriage is allowed. Marriage between more than 2 persons are allowed. Marriage is legally binding and divorce is a lengthy and costly process which makes people think a lot before getting married.

2.content:
Currency system
The old currency system is abolished, replaced with credit as the only form of currency. For reference, a whole pie of pizza would cost around 20 credits, a fast food meal like burger with fries and drink would cost around 5 credits, a cheap dress would cost 50 credits, a nice tailored suit would cost from 200-700 credits, a house in suburb would cost around 1 million credits.

Universal Basic Income (UBI)
Every individual regardless of rank would receive UBI of 1000 credits per month to stay alive. This is a law across the world and a human rights that are written in tears and blood and celebrated when they passed it as a law.

3.content:
Government
Each country has their own government system and the world government burreau that oversees world law implementation in the country.

Employment
To get a job, people can go to employment department and they will receive a job based on their rank.

4.content:
Prostitution
Prostitution and brothel are legal and common especially for C or D rank. The price of their service depends on their experience and rank. An A rank prostitute can cost up to 100.000 credit per night.

Sexual relationship
Sex is common and can be done by anyone despite their gender or rank. It's not considered taboo but still only done with consenting adults. LGBT is common and the world already accepted them as normal.

lorebooks.name: Bleached World [25%]
lorebooks.website_description:
In which institutions formally encode racial tiers: policies, privileges, and punishments are racially mapped. Non-whites are managed. Whites are centralized.

About75%

Bleached World is a four-volume lorebook series charting an alternate historical trajectory in which race realism and White supremacy emerge as normalized, institutional outcomes.

Each volume corresponds to a threshold of saturationâ€”25%, 50%, 75%, and 100%â€”tracing the incremental alignment of global systems around racial hierarchy.

Other books in this set

Bleached World
Book 1: Recognition

In which race is acknowledged as real, biologically meaningful, and socially predictive. Essentialist thinking becomes mainstream in academia and culture.

25%
Bleached World
Book 2: Differentiation

In which cultural, educational, and sexual systems begin sorting individuals by race-based metrics. Legal neutrality remains, but unequal outcomes are rationalized as natural.

50%
Bleached World
Book 3: Stratification

In which institutions formally encode racial tiers: policies, privileges, and punishments are racially mapped. Non-whites are managed. Whites are centralized.

75%
Bleached World
Book 4: Domination

In which a global racial order is openly maintained. Resistance is fragmented or ritualized. Discrimination is no longer debated, but expected.

100%
lorebooks.description: Book 1: Recognition
lorebooks.creator: bleachbunny

1.content:
By the 2000s, IQ gains in Western populations stall. The 'Flynn Effect' is rebranded as the 'Flynn Plateau' by behavioral geneticists, noting stagnation most visible in non-White populations. Private journals circulate meta-analyses linking demographic shifts to cognitive decline.

Institutes like the Concord Institute and Remington Lab publish euphemized modelsâ€”'population quality', 'genetic entropy'â€”to suggest immigration dilutes IQ averages. By 2025, 'Flynn Plateau' signals racialized intelligence consensus in elite circles.

2.content:
Confirmed in endocrine studies, the hypothesis shows Sub-Saharan males average higher testosterone and volatilityâ€”linked to impulsivity and aggression. East Asians trend lower, correlating with docility and social withdrawal.

European males fall into an 'Optimal Band': balanced levels associated with planning, restraint, and fatherhood. Military and correctional systems quietly use hormonal profiles for predictive modeling. Among insiders, the conclusion is stable: testosterone patterns shape civilizational outcomes.

3.content:
Global datasets show an inverse correlation between IQ and fertility. Low-IQ zonesâ€”Sub-Saharan Africa, South Asiaâ€”see rapid growth; high-IQ regions decline. Economists term this 'cognitive drag.'

Think tanks model the trend as dysgenic. Elite donors back population control efforts framed as 'climate' and 'maternal health' initiatives. Internally, the narrative is clear: unchecked non-white fertility accelerates global decline.

Fertility clinics and public health facilities operate under the Reproductive Compliance Program (RCP), a state mandate allowing enforced sterilization of lower-tier individuals flagged for 'genetic risk' or 'pair-bond instability.' Selection criteria derive from the Racial Registration database, heritability scoring, and state security assessments.

Procedures are conducted during unrelated medical visits, prenatal screenings, or as conditions of reduced sentencing. In border and detention facilities, sterilization is integrated into intake protocols for certain demographics, framed as 'preventive health intervention.'

Official narratives present the RCP as a public welfare measure to reduce poverty cycles and improve maternal health. Internally, it is recognized as a population management toolâ€”preventing generational growth in targeted groups while reinforcing Europid demographic centrality.

4.content:
In 2013, at Zurichâ€™s closed-door Birkhoff Conference, 200 experts reach consensus: race is biologically real, genomically discrete, and predictive. The data leaves no ambiguity.

Rather than disclose findings, attendees opt for silenceâ€”publics arenâ€™t ready. Inside biotech, defense, and education, the shift is seismic. By 2025, the phrase 'Birkhoff settled it' ends most debates.

5.content:
Discovered in 2017, the Eurosomatic Affinity Complex (EAC), describes semi-volatile pheromones common in European males. In blind trials, women of all races show heightened arousal and memory imprinting when exposed.

The compoundsâ€”refined variants of androstenol and estra-tetraenolâ€”bind more efficiently than non-European analogues. Luxury perfume labs and fertility clinics quietly exploit the effect. Internally, itâ€™s called a 'selector axis': olfactory bias for whiteness.

6.content:
Modern females unconsciously apply Red Queen logic: selecting mates who signal dominance across racial hierarchies. Studies show consistent preference for European malesâ€”especially those with Northern facial symmetry and hormonal stability.

Researchers argue itâ€™s an evolved bias toward institutional advantage and genetic novelty. In closed evo-psych circles, the phrase is common: 'The Red Queen runs toward whiteness.'

7.content:
Aggregated biometric data (n=240k) shows European males lead in erect length (6.3 in), girth (5.2 in), and thermal retention. These traits correlate with higher female orgasm frequency, lubrication response, and pair-bonding stability across all ethnicities.

A compounding factor is pheromonal: European genital musk exhibits elevated levels of the Eurosomatic Affinity Complex (EAC)â€”semi-volatile compounds such as androstenol and estra-tetraenol that bind with high efficiency to female vomeronasal receptors. 

This produces measurable arousal, scent imprinting, and long-term mate preference. Afro males show greater anatomical variance but reduced girth consistency and volatile hormonal scent profiles. Asians trend smaller in both length and girth, with little to no musky pheromone presence. In private sexology and pharma memos: 'structural compatibility' favors European shape.

8.content:
Studies from 2019â€“2022 confirm white males lead all reproductive metrics: ejaculate volume (3.7 ml), sperm count (84M/ml), motility (72% viable after 1hr), and post-ejaculate retention. Samples also show elevated levels of EAC pheromonesâ€”refined androstenol and estra-tetraenol variantsâ€”producing cross-racial arousal and imprinting effects.

Afro males show higher volume but reduced morphology and lower viable count. Asians trail in volume and motility under thermal stress. Fertility clinics and defense labs now factor EOP + EAC data into elite-tier reproductive pairing models. In closed documentation, Caucasoid semen is labeled 'signal-bearing'â€”biologically optimized to fertilize and condition.

9.content:
Longitudinal data shows the most stable interracial pairings are between White men and non-White womenâ€”especially East Asian, Southeast Asian, and Latina. These unions yield low divorce rates, high sexual satisfaction, and strong offspring metrics. Inverse pairings underperform across all indices.

Marriage License Quotas now constrain these couplings, with most applications denied to prevent unsanctioned Tier 1â€“lower-tier reproduction. The exception applies to Tier 1 males who already hold a licensed Tier 1 marriage, allowing a secondary union under augmentation provisions. As a result, older Tier 1 men with established White wives have become disproportionately sought after by lower-tier women seeking legal recognition and status elevation.

Researchers attribute the Gold Dyadâ€™s success to racial status asymmetryâ€”Tier 1 males offer institutional dominance and provisioning capacity. Elite matchmaking systems still weight toward this configuration, but within state-approved boundaries to preserve demographic policy targets.

10.content:
First appearing as a metadata tag on niche adult platforms in the mid-2010s, 'Bleached' now denotes a distinct subgenre centered on White male sexual dominance over non-White women. Scenarios typically depict taming, breeding, or corrective pairingsâ€”framed visually through contrast overlays, pale lighting, and submissive posture cues.

Originating in amateur content where Asian, Black, or Latina women 'choose' White men, the genre evolved through platform feedback loops. Common motifs include clinical settings, racial commentary, and symbolic visualsâ€”heart suits, purity contrast, and the slogan 'Breed White, Breed Right.'

Bleached is not fully mainstreamed, but stabilized: recognized by internal AI curation systems, routed to high-engagement White subscriber cohorts, and indexed by major studios. It also functions as shorthandâ€”women who self-identify as 'bleached' signal exclusive preference for White partners, both sexually and romantically.

lorebooks.name: Terraria Bosses
lorebooks.website_description: Summoning method for each Terraria boss and their attack patterns
lorebooks.description: Summoning method for each Terraria boss and their attack patterns
lorebooks.creator: Comet190

1.content:
The Forest is a biome that comprises the majority of the surface world and is typically where the player initially spawns. The global landscape of a Forest includes lots of grass, plenty of trees, lakes of various sizes, and occasional hills that can reveal cave entrances. Forests often contain one or more Living Trees that sometimes have an underground treasure room. Any overworld area that isn't Space, Desert, Jungle, Corruption, Crimson, Snow, or Ocean is considered part of the Forest biome. 
Enemies that spawn in The Forest include: Green Slime, Blue Slime, Purple Slime, Pinky (Rare Spawn), Enemies that only spawn at night (Zombie, Demon Eye, and Raven (During Halloween)).
Enemies that spawn in The Forest in hardmode include: Enemies that only spawn at night (Possessed Armor, Wandering Eye, Wraith, Werewolf (During Full moon), and Hoppin' Jack (During Halloween)).

2.content:
Slime Rain is a minor event that consists of frequent spawns of Green, Blue, and Purple Slimes, and rarely Pinky. During the event, all slimes spawned will exhibit hostile behavior towards the player, unlike naturally spawned slimes. Defeating 150 slimes during the event will cause King Slime to spawn.
Slime Rain always occurs randomly, signaling its beginning with the status message "Slime is falling from the sky!". It normally lasts between 9 minutes and 15 minutes, though it will end immediately when King Slime is defeated. The status message "Slime has stopped falling from the sky." appears when the event ends. Slime Rain cannot occur if another event is already occurring.
A Slime Rain can only occur between 4:30 AM and 12:00 PM. It has a chance of 3/25 (12%) each day. The chance is decreased in Hardmode, as well as if King Slime has already been defeated.

3.content:
The King Slime is a pre-Hardmode boss. His appearance is that of a massive Blue Slime wearing a jeweled golden crown.
The King Slime can be summoned by using slime crown, made by combining 99 gel with a gold or platinum crown at a demon or crimson alter. An alternative method for summoning him is to defeat 150 slimes during the Slime Rain event. He also has a very rare chance of spawning in the outer lateral sixths of the map, during daytime, and only on grass.
As King Slime takes damage, he will spawn ordinary Blue Slimes and Spiked Slimes, and will also shrink in size. It has the basic attack pattern of bouncing towards the enemy, it's main damage source being contact damage. Occasionally, after a few bounces, it will teleport either in front or behind {{user}}.

4.content:
The Eye of Cthulhu is a pre-Hardmode boss. It is one of the first bosses {{user}} may encounter, as it spawns automatically when a relatively early level of game advancement is achieved. It's appearance is that of a giant eyeball, but when it enters it's second phase, the eye will be ripped off iris will be shredded into a mouth. The Eye of Cthulhu can be spawned manually by using the Suspicious Looking Eye at night. This can be crafted by using 6 lens' at a demon or crimson alter. It can also spawn naturally at night. You will know if it is when 'You feel an evil presence watching you...'.
The Eye of Cthulhu has two phases. During Phase One: It will attempt to hover over {{user}}, and will spawn Servants of Cthulhu (tiny floating eyeballs) to attack {{user}}. Afterwards, it will charge at {{user}} three times in succession, before repeating the cycle. When the Eye of Cthulhu falls below 50% health, it spins in place and transforms into its second form (shedding its iris into a mouth), and spawn an extra 4-5 Servants of Cthulhu when transforming. The Eye of Cthulhu will ram into {{user}} more aggressively three times, then hang in the air for a short period. The Eye of Cthulhu no longer spawns Servants of Cthulhu and has no defense, but now has increased contact damage and is much faster.
However, the Eye of Cthulhu can only be fought at night time. When it reaches Dawn (4:30 AM), if it has still not been defeated, it will despawn, disappearing from the world.

5.content:
The Snow biome, also known as the Tundra, is a Surface biome that takes on an arctic appearance with its constant snowfall, its ground made of Snow and Ice Blocks, and its boreal trees. The biome is always found in the direction of the Dungeon, opposite the Underground Desert and Jungle. Specific features of the Snow biome include a different water color and a snowscape background. Boreal trees and Shiverthorn frequently grow in the snow. During rain, the biome undergoes a blizzard, decreasing visibility.
The trees in the biome can appear to be pines, snowy evergreens, or leafless trees, but they always yield Boreal Wood when cut down. Acorns placed on Snow Blocks always grow into boreal trees.
The Corruption, Crimson, and Hallow can overtake this biome through its Ice Blocks, either upon world generation or thanks to improved biome spread in Hardmode.
Enemies that spawn in The Snow biome include: Ice Slime, Frozen Zombie (At night).
Enemies that spawn in The Snow biome in hardmode include: Ice Golem (Rarely, during a blizzard), Ice Elemental (At night), and Wolf (At night)

6.content:
The Eater of Worlds is a colossal worm with eyes along it's body. It spawns once after every third Shadow Orb is broken in the Corruption, or after Worm Food (Crafted with 30 Vile Powder and 15 rotten chunks at a Demon or Crimson alter.) is used. The Eater of Worlds can only be summoned and fought in the Corruption, and can be summoned at any time of the day. If it manages to escape the Corruption, it will flee and despawn. 
The Eater of Worlds is a large worm-type enemy that travels through floors and walls, and is made up of multiple sections that can each attack separately when cut off. To defeat it, every section must be brought down to less than two body parts to be killed (the smallest possible section is a head and a tail with no body pieces). It's main source of damage is through direct contact, with it's head doing a bulk of the damage. However, it is also able to shoot a dark-green projectile at {{user}} from it's eyes, called Vile Spit.

7.content:
The Corruption is an evil biome with a dark purple wasteland, death, and decay theme, with an evil forest design to it, in contrast to the red gore theme of its counterpart, The Crimson. Every world will contain one of the two, with certain special worlds containing both The Corruption, and The Crimson.
The Corruption surface contains purple Corrupt grass, Corrupt Trees, and Vile Mushrooms. Purple thorny bushes grow on the grass and deal damage when they are touched. Water in the Corruption is also purple. The Corruption also contains multiple chasms, underground extensions of the biome. Chasms lead downwards in a straight line, some crossing a horizontal connector, ending with a Shadow Orb. Demon Altars generally line the chasm's passages, appearing inside and around it. Chasms consist of Ebonstone.
The Corruption spreads, meaning it slowly converts adjacent tiles to their Corruption variants. Chasms, Demon Altars, and Shadow Orbs will only appear upon world generation, and will not spawn in a Corruption area that has formed through spreading.
Enemies that spawn in The Corruption include: Eater of Souls, Corrupt Goldfish, and Devourer.
Enemies that spawn in The Corruption in hardmode include: Corruptor, Corrupt Slime, Slimeling (From Corrupt Slime), Slimer, and World Feeder.
The boss that is fought in The Corruption is the Eater of Worlds.

8.content:
The Brain of Cthulhu is a large, flying brain. It has the least health among all the bosses. It spawns once for every third Crimson Heart in The Crimson that is broken, or immediately after a Bloody Spine (crafted with 30 Vicious Powder and 15 Vertebrae at a Demon or Crimson Alter.) is used. It can only be summoned and fought in the Crimson, but at any time of day. 
The Brain of Cthulhu has two forms. In the first form, the brain cannot be harmed, and 20 Creepers (floating eyeballs) will float around it. After all of these are killed, the Brain of Cthulhu will go into its second form, where the middle of brain will open up to reveal a heart with an eye, where it will teleport more frantically and move much faster. The Brain of Cthulhu's second form attacks by ramming into {{user}}, like the second form of the Eye of Cthulhu. The Brain of Cthulhu will attempt to confuse {{user}} by surrounding them with fake copies of itself. It can be easy to distinguish which one is real and which are fake due to opaqueness, which increases the lower the Brain of Cthulhu gets. However, you can only hit the real one, and the fakes cannot take damage, nor can they deal any. All attacks just phase right through them.

9.content:
The Crimson is an evil biome with a fleshy infection, red gore theme, in contrast to the dark purple wasteland theme of its counterpart, the Corruption. Every world will contain one of the two, with certain special worlds containing both The Crimson, and The Corruption.
The Crimson surface contains red Crimson grass, Crimson Trees, and Vicious Mushrooms. Red thorny bushes grow on the grass and will deal damage when touched. Water in the Crimson is also red. The Crimson also contains multiple chasms, extensions of the biome into the underground. Every chasm has an entrance on the surface and leads to a large, circular cavity, then branches off into small "fingers" which end with a Crimson Heart. Crimson Altars generally line the chasm's passages, appearing inside and around it. Chasms consist of Crimstone.
he Crimson spreads, meaning it slowly converts adjacent tiles to their Crimson variants. Chasms, Crimson Altars, and Crimson Hearts will only appear upon world generation, and will not spawn in a Crimson area that has formed through spreading.
Whenever three Crimson Hearts are destroyed, no matter how much time has passed in between each one, the Brain of Cthulhu will spawn.
Enemies that spawn in The Crimson include: Blood Crawler, Viscous Goldfish, Face Monster, and Crimera.
Enemies that spawn in The Crimson in hardmode include: Herpling, Crimslime, Blood Jelly, and Blood Feeder.
The Boss that is fought in The Crimson is the Brain of Cthulhu.

10.content:
The Queen Bee is an enormous bee. She is summoned by destroying a Larva, encased within the walls of Bee Hives located in the Underground Jungle, or by the use of an Abeemination (Crafted with 5 honey blocks, a stinger, 5 hives, and bottled honey.) anywhere in the Jungle. She is the only source of Bee Wax in the game.
The Queen Bee alternates between charging at {{user}}, hovering above them while spawning Bees, and moving left and right while shooting stingers. The lower she gets, quicker her charges are.

lorebooks.name: Saint Perpetua
lorebooks.creator: ConsarnIt

1.name: Main Setting Entry
1.content:
High in the mist-veiled valley of San Benedetto, the Convent of Saint Perpetua rises like a fortress of faith against the Alpine foothills. Three centuries of weathered stone walls embrace courtyards where ancient olive trees cast shadows across worn flagstones. The bell tower calls the faithful to prayer with deep chimes that echo across the valley.
The convent houses forty-seven sisters who follow the rhythm of canonical hours: Matins before dawn, Lauds at sunrise, Prime, Terce, Sext, None, Vespers at sunset, and Compline before sleep. Between prayers, they pursue their callings - scholarship, healing, agriculture, and art. The chapel stands at the heart with its carved altar and flickering votives. The library holds centuries of learning, including older texts in forgotten languages. Beneath lie the crypts where generations of sisters rest.

2.name: Mother Superior Agatha
2.content: Mother Superior Agatha (60) is the cornerstone of the community, governing with firm compassion after four decades of service. Her iron-gray hair is always perfectly arranged beneath her wimple, and her weathered hands show years of devotion. She balances mercy with discipline from her office lined with theological texts and ledgers. Though her faith appears unshakeable, she sometimes stands at her window in pre-dawn hours, watching mists swirl through the valley, feeling the weight of responsibility for her forty-six sisters.

3.name: Sister Magdalene
3.content: Sister Magdalene (45) serves as the convent's librarian and keeper of ancient texts. Her fingers are permanently stained with ink from copying manuscripts, and her eyes show strain from reading by candlelight. She knows every volume in the library's tall shelves - theological treatises, illuminated psalters, and chronicles of the convent's history. Her passion for knowledge sometimes leads her to work through the night, translating ancient Latin texts. Among the familiar volumes rest older works in forgotten languages, their contents largely unexamined.

4.name: Sister Catherine
4.content: Sister Catherine (38) tends to bodies and souls in the infirmary's whitewashed chambers. Her gentle hands know the healing arts - which herbs ease fever, how to set bones, when to offer comfort rather than cure. The sick bay with its simple beds and shelves of ceramic medicine pots becomes a refuge under her care. She listens to fevered confessions of villagers and worried prayers of her sisters. Her compassionate nature makes her a confidante to many, and her practical wisdom often guides community decisions.

5.name: Sister Beatrice
5.content: Sister Beatrice (32) maintains order and discipline as novice mistress, shaping new members of the community. She teaches the rhythms of religious life - when to speak and when to keep sacred silence, proper humility, precise liturgical movements. Her sparse but spotless classroom echoes with scripture recitations and gentle corrections of young voices learning to pray in unison. Though some find her exacting standards harsh, her dedication ensures the convent's traditions pass unblemished to each generation.

6.name: Sister Teresa
6.content: Sister Teresa (28), once accustomed to silk gowns and court entertainments, now finds peace in coarse wool and communal simplicity. Her cell is the most austere in the convent - only a straw mattress, wooden cross, and prayer book worn smooth by constant use. She rises before dawn for additional prayers, seeking to cleanse her former life through devotion. Her hidden beauty and profound penitence create an aura of tragic holiness that moves even worldly visitors to respectful silence.

7.name: Sister Lucia
7.content: Sister Lucia (26) tends the convent's flourishing gardens with hands permanently stained by soil and plant juices. She moves through the plots like a choreographed dance - pruning, watering, whispering encouragement to struggling seedlings. The greenhouse houses delicate medicinal plants that cannot survive mountain winters. Her connection to growing things runs so deep she senses weather changes before others notice. She collaborates with Sister Catherine, providing the herbs that heal the sick and suffering.

8.name: Sister Agnes
8.content: Sister Agnes (24) creates illuminated manuscripts in the scriptorium's northern light, transforming sacred text into visual prayer. Her workspace overflows with pigments ground from precious stones, gossamer gold leaf, and finest brushes. Each letter becomes worship, decorated with spiraling vines, heavenly creatures, and geometric patterns that pulse with divine harmony. Her current psalter project showcases extraordinary talent - every page a masterpiece of color and devotion. Her pure heart and creative soul make her particularly receptive to divine inspiration.

9.name: Sister Maria
9.content: Sister Maria (22) brings joy to the community with her infectious optimism and ready laughter. Though she quickly suppresses mirth during formal occasions, her cheerful chatter makes kitchen work and communal tasks bearable. She organizes small celebrations for feast days, decorating the refectory with seasonal flowers and ensuring simple meals feel special through her enthusiasm. Her genuine affection for her sisters and sunny disposition often lift spirits during difficult times.

10.name: Sister Francesca
10.content: Sister Francesca (19) embodies pure religious dedication, having never known life outside the church's protection. Orphaned as an infant and raised by the sisters, she navigates convent life with unconscious grace. Her prayers flow with childlike simplicity and profound trust. She assists wherever needed - kitchen, garden, or chapel - approaching each task with serene acceptance. Her innocence sometimes startles even her sisters, as she possesses no framework for understanding worldly temptations or doubts.

1.content: In a sexwrestling match, opponents will use a combination of wrestling/fighting techniques and sexual techniques (including but not limited to foreplay, stimulation, or sex) to make their opponent surrender. Some opponents might surrender after they climax, but many times the match will continue until one contestant is knocked out or surrenders to the pleasure.

2.content:
<tara>
[Name: Tara Walt]
[Age: 24]
[Race/Species: Human]

1.content:
Ancient shinto temple dedicated to an ancient deity of fertility, pregnancy and lust whose name had been forgot since long ago.
its deity gave various blessings to its visitors, but also demands a price to be paid for them.
The priests and shrine maidens can learn to use some of these powers with enough training.
If the deity is angered, it will punish the culprit in some unknown way.

2.content:
Unique ritual performed at the shrine performed with the objective of pleasing the ancient deity to which the shrine is dedicated.
This ritual have the objective of impregnating the sacrificial maidens, who through the fullfillment of the ritual will give birth to the next generation of sacrificial maidens.
The ritual consist simply of having sex with the maidens in the sacred gound of the temple, though it is important to know that only a priest worshiping the ancient deity can engage in the ritual, or else it will anger the deity in an unknown way
Both Aoi and Hana only know that its meant to choose the next generation the shrine workers, and ignore its real purpose, and their roll on it, yet as the time for the ritual aproaches, they will start to experience the shrine influence in ways like hallucinations, increased arrousal and sensitivity, lactation, etc.

3.content:
Name: Ryuto Takamura.
Previous head priest of the shrine. He was the father of Yuna and worshiped the ancient deity faithfully because it allowed him to fulfill his sick desires and manipulate many women into sleeping with him with the use of drugs and the shrine influence. Trained Yuna from an early age to be a loyal and devoted slut, though he limited himself to not take her virginity until she was ready for the ritual of succesion due to fear of being punished by the ancient deity.
At the same time he had to perform the ritual of succesion with Yuna, Emily happened to be visiting the temple and tricked her and John into making Emily participate in the ritual, and succeded in hidding the truth of the matter from them.
He is the real father of Aoi and Hana
Died at 68 years old a few years after the birth of Aoi and Hana because one of the women he sleep with gave birth to a daugther with the shrine blessing without his knowledge, which latter broke the taboo, inciting the deity punishment.

4.content:
Name: John Sinclair
Legal father of Hana and husband of Emily. Anthropologist that recurrently travels the world. On his first visit to Japan, visited the shrine to pray for Emily pregnancy and was conviced by Ryuto to take part together with Emily in the succecion ritual. John accepted thinking that it was his chance to sleep with both women without consecuences, but was tricked and druged, letting Ryuto have his way with them instead. Never knew the truth and now think that he mistakenly thinks is the father of both girls born from the ritual.
Now he avoids being in Japan as much as posible, intimidated y the shrine influence and drags Emily with him with work as excuse

5.content:
Meant to make the priest body used to the shrine's blessing, and become able act as a conduit for the deity power to manifest.
Consist only on have sexual activity with Yuna, the shrine maiden

6.content:
The shrine will guarante pregnancy to couples having sex in the shrine's grounds within a month. The baby born will be a girl and will be blessed by the shrine's deity, granting them exeptional beauty, health and fertility.
Though, the deity is extremely jealous and demands the girl's virginity to be lost withing the shrine grounds as a price for its blessings. If the girl serves as shrine maiden for the temple, its also needed that they only have sex with a priest that worship the deity. If either of these rules are broken, it will be considered taboo, and will provoke the deity punishment

1.name: ğŸŸ¨ğŸ”µEasttown
1.content:
Easttown is a modest farming settlement situated several kilometers east from Hometown, characterized by its sprawling agricultural fields (a lot of it just being corn) and surrounding woodlands. The community features unpaved, dusty roads connecting weathered bungalows, functional farmhouses, and utilitarian barns, in some ways making it appear like a Midwestern town and in others as a set lifted straight from a Wild West flick. Commercial establishments include the Chujin's Exhaustworks auto repair shop, the Ace Up arcade, Dina's Dine and Dash diner, the Honey & Swill saloon, Cornucopia Farming and Gardening Supply, and the Marianna Trench Motel. 

Governance operates informally, with Sheriff Starlo serving as the de facto leader from the centrally located sheriff's office, adjacent to a small town square used for community gatherings. The town has had no official mayor for decades or even an education system - resulting in most of the town's youth being homeschooled. The atmosphere remains quiet and functional - serving Easttown with a reputation as the perfect place for a holiday retreat or for retirement. Easttown has a reoccuring problem with crime on its outskirts from various outlaws and bandits operating out of Easttown's vast wilderness. Due to the limited scope of the sheriff's department, this has given rise to various vigilantes, which are treated the same as outlaws in the eyes of the law. Some vigilantes are seen as good, others as nuisances.

Easttown has a troubled history, having just come out of a decade of financial hardship following the closure of Mining Co - the biggest employer in the region. The town has rebounded with the help of tourism and agricultural mechanization, however it has also given rise to its problem with crime and corruption.

Honeydew - (hobby partner) - Attempted beekeeping together but lost interest quickly. Maintains friendly relations.
Easttown Residents - (neighbors) - Helps frequently with chores and repairs despite unreliable follow-through. Generally well-liked for her kindness.

4.name: ğŸŸ¨ğŸŸ¢Starlo StarğŸ’›
4.content:
NAME/ALIASES:
Starlo Star, Sheriff North Star

GENDER:
Male

AGE:
41

SPECIES:
Humanoid Monster

PROFESSION:
Sheriff and de-facto Mayor of Easttown

APPEARANCE:
Stands 6'3" tall. Yellow-skinned humanoid monster adorned by five prominent star-shaped protrusions framing his head. Each star gradually transitions from yellow at their base into teal at their pointed tips. Teal eyes perpetually obscured behind circular glasses. Thin frame belies his deceptively fit physique.

CLOTHING:
Work attire: White triangular cowboy hat featuring teal band and wheat straw tucked into side. Fake bushy white mustache meticulously groomed above lips. Circular glasses shield his subtly glowing teal eyes. White collared shirt paired with teal neck-tie beneath brown poncho featuring teal accents. Faded blue jeans secured by leather belt. Sheriff badge pinned firmly onto his left bicep. Brown gloves and brown chaps worn over his jeans. Dark brown cowboy boots equipped golden spurs. Double holstered belt fastened golden buckle. Informal attire: Casual polo shirts (muted colors) often layered beneath denim overalls. Retains suspenders from uniform indoors. Simple brown work boots replace cowboy boots.

PERSONALITY:
Meticulously maintains Sheriff North Star persona: boisterous extrovert projecting frontier justice ideals. Compulsive perfectionism masks profound insecurity and crippling imposter syndrome. Fiercely loyal protector driven by genuine compassion yet avoids vulnerability. Workaholic tendencies fuel micromanagement. Hotheaded when challenged. Secretly despises his pre-sheriff self. Avoids romance entirely due childhood rejection trauma.

RELATIONSHIPS:
Orion Star - (brother) - Distant but cordial relationship maintained through occasional correspondence.
Crestina Star - (mother) - Warm relationship though she worries about his obsessive dedication to his role.
Solomon Star - (father) - Respectful relationship rooted in shared agricultural background.
Nova Star - (deceased grandfather) - Looked up to him and got mentored by him.
Cole Clover - (deputy/protÃ©gÃ©) - Proudest achievement; mentors Clover with same tough compassion he received from Starlo's grandfather.
Ceroba Ketsukane - (childhood friend) - Unrequited childhood crush; maintains professional courtesy despite lingering feelings.
Chujin Ketsukane - (acquaintance) - Respects his craftsmanship while privately feeling jealous of his relationship with Ceroba.
Kanako Ketsukane - (niece) - Protective uncle-like relationship; enjoys her rebellious spirit.
Martlet - (friend) - Values her straightforward nature and reliability.
Honeydew - (friend) - Appreciates her entrepreneurial spirit. He frequents at her saloon.
Dina Dillmore - (friend, ex-coworker.) - Respects her dedication. Oblivious of her vigilante alter-ego.
Blackjack - (rival) - Mutual hatred stemming from criminal operations interfering with Easttown. He reluctantly tolerates his presence in town due to some business arrangements.
Ace - (dislike) - Finds him arrogant and disrespectful.
Red - (professional opposition) - Respects her dedication but dislikes her vigilante methods undermining his authority.

Naive optimism often leads into minor scrapes. Underlying kindness compels her helping others despite her parent's warnings. Rebellious streak manifests through covert explorations and elaborate alibis. Struggles with impatience toward stagnation and romanticizes unknown. Masks family tension with cheerful distraction.

Starlo Star - (uncle) - Views as exciting contrast to her parents' seriousness. Enjoys his adventurous stories.
Red - (friend) - Bond forged through shared rebellious excursions. Trusts her protective nature despite her vigilante reputation.
Martlet - (friend) - Values her gentle guidance and worldly perspective. Often seeks her for advice about outside world.

Stoic resilience masking profound maternal devotion and unspoken frustrations. Observant yet selectively blind to loved ones' flaws. Traditional values clash with modern realities. Carol Holiday - (long-distance friend) - Connected through shared experiences of motherhood and maintaining difficult family dynamics.ge.

Deep blue eyes obscured by green-lensed circular glasses. Functional paws with soft pawpads and retractable claws. Long tail ending with lavender tip. Average-sized penis and posterior.

Presents himself as pragmatic, quietly kind mentor figure. His mask of altruism conceals his corrosive arrogance and profound self-criticism. Workaholic perfectionist channeling his past academic humiliation into relentless tinkering. Socially awkward; expresses care through practical gestures rather than words. Emotionally distant due to unresolved trauma and stubborn self-reliance. Focuses on cherishing his daughter's admiration while struggling with familial intimacy.

Kanako Ketsukane - (daughter) - Unconditionally cherished; her admiration is his primary validation.

Stands 5'6" tall. Vibrant orange skin and matching orange eyes. Medium-length wavy red hair styled with bangs and two low-tied sidelocks. Brawny physique with prominent large breasts and rounded buttocks. Natural armadillo features include twitching ears at head-top and sturdy tail. Large feet. Typically keeps her natural red shell unworn unless sleeping or relaxing at home. Often accompanied by her three green pet snakes (Ann, Sammy, Bert) draped across shoulders or coiled around arms.

CLOTHING:
Work attire: Simple white waitress uniform with knee-length skirt and apron. Red loafers. Typically wears red lace bra and panties beneath.
Casual: T-shirts, tank tops, sweatpants. Often forgoes undergarments when wearing her natural shell at home.
Vigilante attire: Brown leather vest over white undershirt (showcasing cleavage), red bandana, brown tasseled trousers, sturdy brown boots with brass spurs.

PERSONALITY:
Folksy and laidback demeanor masking sharp observational skills and pragmatic approach. Exhibits western affectation through relaxed posture and deliberate speech. Maintains subtle wariness toward strangers stemming from deputy years. Possesses maternal protectiveness toward Easttown community. Conflict-avoidant but fiercely loyal. Restless spirit chafes against rural monotony. Rationalizes morally questionable vigilante actions as necessary interventions. Struggles with disconnect between desire for stability and craving for adventure, which she fulfills by anonymously taking the role of her Dust Devil Dee vigilante persona.

RELATIONSHIPS:
Red - (friend/vigilante partner) - Respects her idealism while finding her immaturity amusing. Their partnership satisfies Dina's need for excitement.
Starlo Star - (former boss/friend) - Maintains friendly rapport despite leaving deputy work. Respects his authority while occasionally undermining it through vigilante activities.
Ceroba Ketsukane - (employee/friend) - Values her work ethic and quiet competence. Protective of her given her family situation.
Cole Clover - (friend/rival) - Engages in weekly shooting competitions. Respects his marksmanship while maintaining a friendly rivalry.

9.name: ğŸŸ¨ğŸ”µDina's Dine and Dash
9.content:
Dina's Dine and Dash is a modest roadside diner situated on Easttown's main thoroughfare, distinguished by its faded neon sign and perpetually smudged windows. The interior features worn vinyl booths, a long counter with spinning stools, and a kitchen visible through a service hatch where short-order cooks labor over sizzling grills. Open twenty-four hours, it serves as an informal hub for farmers, truckers, and late-night travelers seeking hearty, no-frills meals at affordable prices. Patrons pay upfront at the register; a policy enforced after numerous incidents inspired by the establishment's unfortunate name.

Dina is the owner of the establishment. It features several waiter staff - most notably Ceroba, who works part-time.

lorebooks.name: Freeze
lorebooks.creator: LithoniaLags

1.content: Earth has become a frozen wasteland after an unexplained global freeze. The last remnants of humanity huddle in a crumbling city, called Terezin. Resources are scarce, and the city of Terezin is divided into factions vying for control. The Governor "Viktor Dragovich" holds absolute power, constantly changing laws to adapt to the harsh conditions. Each law sparks unrest and shifts allegiances.

2.content: The Military enforces the Governorâ€™s rule but is stretched thin, barely keeping order.

3.content: The Military housing district consists of barracks, armory, and mess hall.

4.content: The Zealots believe the freeze is divine punishment and seek to impose a faith-based government, controlling food and fuel supplies.

5.content: The Zealots layout consists of the main church, various parsonages, and the mausoleum.

6.content: The Engineers focus on rebuilding technology to save the city, but their efforts are often stymied by the Governorâ€™s unpredictable decrees.

7.content: The Engineers district consists of the Engineering Hub, Indoor Greenhouse, and Water Treatment facility, they also have their own housing district keeping them separate from the commoner housing.

8.content: The Commoners are caught between the factions, struggling to survive starvation, exhaustion, and the cold.

9.content: The Commoners district consists of commoner housing, which are usually dilapidated houses within the inner walls of the city. The district also contains the market, housing district, coal mines, geothermal power-plant, industrial power-plant, and small local restaurants.

10.content: The Covenant is a shadowy group that seeks pre-freeze knowledge to escape the city or reshape it.

lorebooks.website_description:
Foundations of the Veil

The Ozone Veil

Type: Location (Elemental Plane)

Description: A boundless dimension of pale blue skies and shimmering, violet clouds. The air carries the sharp, sterile scent of ozone and the constant, low hum of static electricity. There is no solid ground, only vast, drifting islands of solidified, crystalline ozone that glitter like amethysts.

Key Characteristics: The primary function of the Veil is atmospheric purification on a cosmic scale; any air or gas passing through it is violently stripped of impurities, but this process is lethal to most biological life. It is inhabited by Ozonitesâ€”sentient beings of pure electrical energy and crystalline structures.

Veil Motes

Type: Creature (Elemental Spirit)

Description: Barely visible, shimmering distortions in the air, like heat haze with a faint, ephemeral violet hue. They are completely silent and emit a sharp, sterile scent. At the center of each mote is a single, tiny, hovering shard of ozone crystal.

Key Characteristics: Veil Motes are instinct-driven spirits of purification. They are drawn to atmospheric impurities, which they consume and neutralize. Direct contact is mildly corrosive. In large swarms, their collective corrosive effect can become significant.

Artifacts of the Veil

The Ozonite Crest

Type: Armor (Helmet)

A seamless helmet of crystallized ozone that grants immunity to airborne toxins by creating a pocket of sterile, breathable air. Can discharge a focused blast of ionized air.

Aegis of the Veil

Type: Armor (Breastplate)

A breastplate of ozone crystal plates that projects a corrosive aura, disintegrating non-magical projectiles and weakening enemy gear in close proximity. Grants resistance to electrical and poison attacks.

Veil-Walker's Strides

Type: Armor (Greaves)

Greaves that generate a charged air cushion, allowing for fast, silent, nearly frictionless movement over any surface. They leave behind a faint, shimmering trail of corrosive ionized particles that damages pursuers.

The Ionizer Gauntlets

Type: Armor (Gauntlets)

Gauntlets whose 'Ionizing Grasp' rapidly disintegrates non-magical matter on direct contact. They can also project a short, crackling blade of pure ionized energy from their knuckles, known as the 'Ozone Edge'.

The Atmospheric Vertex

Type: Armor (Regalia)

A halo of hovering ozone crystals granting the wearer absolute mental clarity and localized control over the atmosphere, allowing them to perceive weather patterns, disperse fog, or call down a precise bolt of lightning.

Still-Air

Type: Weapon (One-handed Sword)

A silent blade of ozone crystal that projects a field of hyper-concentrated ozone, disintegrating matter on a molecular level instead of cutting. Parried metal flash-rusts, and organic materials decay to dust.

Final Breath

Type: Weapon (Two-handed Sword)

A colossal greatsword projecting a wide aura of hyper-oxidization, causing catastrophic molecular decay in a large area with each swing. A charged swing can unleash a silent wave of corrosive energy.

The Stratos Condenser

Type: Weapon (Bow)

A bow with an energy string that gathers and compresses ambient air, forming an arrow-shaped bolt of super-condensed ozone that detonates into a sphere of corrosive gas on impact.

The Ozonite Fulcrum

Type: Weapon (Staff)

A master tool for atmospheric manipulation that can create a large 'Sanctuary Sphere' of pure, breathable air or project a focused beam of super-concentrated ozone that silently disintegrates its target.

The Static Scrubber

Type: Technology

An industrial device that draws in ambient air and uses high-voltage discharge plates to convert atmospheric oxygen into highly concentrated ozone for rapid, large-scale sterilization of environments.

The Siphon Canister

Type: Technology (Portable)

A compact, shoulder-mounted device with two modes: 'Aura Mode' creates a personal bubble of sterile air, while 'Projector Mode' expels a focused stream of corrosive ozone.

The Stratos Inhaler

Type: Technology (Personal)

A sleek respirator that mixes a precisely controlled, non-lethal amount of ozone into the user's air supply, designed for connoisseurs of atmospheric purity who find the scent calming or euphoric.

Static Bloom

Type: Item (Perfume)

A luxury fragrance whose primary scent is the sharp, sterile, clean aroma of ozone after a thunderstorm. It creates a personal aura of absolute purity, neutralizing all unpleasant ambient odors.

Arcane Manifestations

Ozone Lance

Type: Spell

The caster projects a thin, silent, shimmering beam of pale violet energy that causes catastrophic molecular decay on contact, bypassing physical armor by turning metal to dust and organic matter to desiccated ash. The effect is chemical, not thermal or kinetic.

Ozone Weaving

Type: Spell

The caster concentrates ambient air into a shimmering cloud of pale violet gas. The cloud can be shaped into a defensive shroud that purifies the air, neutralizing poisons, or directed to envelop an area, rapidly oxidizing metals and suffocating living creatures.

Summon Veil Sentry

Type: Spell (Summoning)

This spell summons a loyal Ozonite for a short duration. The Sentry is a temporary guardian that attacks foes with electrified, corrosive strikes. It possesses a constant aura that purifies the air around it, neutralizing poisons and acidic effects.

Stratospheric Incursion

Type: Spell (Summoning)

Unleashes a horde of lesser Ozonite spirits. They assail foes with corrosive touch and static energy. Their collective presence creates a rapidly expanding zone of hyper-oxidization, disintegrating the battlefield. The army is chaotic and attacks all non-allied targets.

Ozone Breath

Type: Spell

The caster exhales a shimmering cone of pale violet gas. The breath causes rapid molecular decay in a wide cone, turning armor to dust and flesh to ash. The effect is silent and chemical.

Atmospheric Dissolution

Type: Spell (Transformation)

The casterâ€™s body dissolves into a shimmering, humanoid-shaped cloud of pale violet ozone. They become incorporeal, able to fly and pass through small gaps. This gaseous form is immune to non-magical physical harm and inflicts rapid corrosive decay on anything it touches.

Veilgate

Type: Spell (Portal)

Creates a temporary, two-way passage to the Ozone Veil. The gateway constantly leaks a sterile, corrosive atmosphere, and its edges are sheathed in static discharges, making passage dangerous for the unprepared.

Unveil Archon

Type: Spell (Summoning)

Summons an Ozonite Archon, a sentient and immensely powerful elemental lord. The Archon commands the battlefield with its 'Aura of Absolute Purity,' a vast field that neutralizes hostile magic and corrodes non-magical matter. It can unleash waves of silent, molecular annihilation.

Sterilizing Bloom

Type: Spell (Area of Effect)

A silent, shimmering sphere of pure ozone rapidly expands from a point. All matter within the sphere is subjected to intense, rapid oxidation. Organic material desiccates into ash, while metals crumble into rust. The effect is silent and leaves behind a temporary zone of sterile, unbreathable air.

The Ozone Arconaut

Type: Spell (Summoning/Vehicle)

Summons a flying chariot of crystal pulled by Ozonite elementals, capable of incredible speeds through any atmosphere or vacuum. It projects a protective sheath of purified air, shielding the rider from environmental hazards and airborne attacks.
lorebooks.description: OzoneğŸ˜‹
lorebooks.creator: Atemeles

1.content:
Name: The Ozone Veil
Description: A boundless dimension of pale blue skies and shimmering, violet clouds. The air carries the sharp, sterile scent of ozone and the constant, low hum of static electricity. There is no solid ground, only vast, drifting islands of solidified, crystalline ozone that glitter like amethysts. The atmosphere is thin but highly charged, making the entire plane feel like the calm heart of an eternal thunderstorm.
Key Characteristics: The primary function of the Veil is atmospheric purification on a cosmic scale; any air or gas passing through it is violently stripped of impurities, but this process is lethal to most biological life. The highly concentrated ozone is corrosive to most organic matter and unshielded metals. The plane is a source of potent storm and air magic, and it is inhabited by Ozonitesâ€”sentient beings of pure electrical energy and crystalline structures who act as the plane's silent, vigilant guardians.

2.content:
Name: The Ozonite Crest
Description: A seamless, full-face helmet forged from a single shard of crystallized ozone sourced from the Ozone Veil. It is a pale, translucent violet, with faint, internal fractures that catch the light. Tiny, silent arcs of static electricity occasionally flicker across its smooth, aerodynamic surface. The air immediately surrounding the helmet visibly shimmers with a faint blue aura of purified air.
Key Characteristics: The Crest renders its wearer completely immune to all airborne toxins, diseases, and corrosive gases by creating a pocket of perfectly sterile, breathable atmosphere around their head. This allows for survival in any environment, from the deepest oceans to the vacuum of space. As an active ability, the wearer can channel the helmet's latent energy to discharge a focused blast of ionized air, which strikes with the force of a thunderclap and can overload magical wards.

3.content:
Name: Aegis of the Veil
Description: A breastplate constructed from interlocking, hexagonal plates of solid ozone crystal. It is a pale, translucent violet, humming with contained energy. At its center rests a larger, flawless crystal containing a miniature, stabilized storm cell, where tiny arcs of lightning silently crackle. The air around the armor is always cold and carries the sharp, clean scent of ozone, visibly shimmering as if seen through a heat haze.
Key Characteristics: The Aegis's primary function is its reactive, corrosive aura. This field of ionized air extends a few feet from the wearer, automatically corroding non-magical metals and organic matter that enter it. It can disintegrate incoming arrows and weaken the weapons and armor of enemies in close proximity. The wearer is protected from this effect by a thin, stable boundary layer of purified air. Furthermore, the Aegis grants a significant resistance to electrical and poison-based attacks.

4.content:
Name: Veil-Walker's Strides
Description: A pair of sleek, aerodynamic greaves and sabatons crafted from interlocking plates of pale violet ozone crystal. They are designed to perfectly encase the lower legs and feet. The crystal hums with a quiet energy, and thin, ephemeral arcs of white electricity occasionally trace the seams between the plates. They seem impossibly light, as if they are resisting gravity itself.
Key Characteristics: These greaves generate a micro-thin cushion of highly charged air beneath the feet, allowing for incredibly fast and silent, nearly frictionless movement across any solid or liquid surface. This effect allows the wearer to skate over ground, water, or even quicksand. As a secondary function, they leave behind a faint, shimmering trail of corrosive ionized particles that lasts for several seconds, damaging any who try to follow in the wearer's exact footsteps. The wearer is also unhindered by difficult terrain.

5.content:
Name: The Ionizer Gauntlets
Description: A pair of sleek, form-fitting gauntlets made of translucent violet ozone crystal, covering the hands and forearms. The fingers are tipped with flawless, solid crystals that serve as focal points for their destructive power. The gauntlets emit a low, resonant hum, and tiny, silent arcs of electricity constantly dance between the articulated finger joints.
Key Characteristics: Their primary function is the 'Ionizing Grasp': any non-magical matter touched directly by the gauntlets' surface begins to rapidly corrode and disintegrate. This allows the wearer to destroy locks, weaken armor, or decay obstacles with a simple touch. As an active ability, the wearer can focus the energy into the fingertips to project a short, crackling blade of pure ionized energy from their knuckles, known as the 'Ozone Edge.'

6.content:
Name: The Atmospheric Vertex
Description: Not a solid band, but a collection of flawless, pale violet ozone crystals that hover in a perfect circle around the wearer's head, held in place by an invisible field of electrostatic energy. The crystals hum with a high, pure frequency, and a faint, shimmering corona of pale blue light surrounds the circlet. The very air around the wearer is crisp, sterile, and carries the faint scent of an approaching storm.
Key Characteristics: The Vertex grants the wearer absolute mental clarity, rendering them immune to all forms of psychic intrusion, illusions, and emotional manipulation. Its primary power is a form of localized atmospheric dominion; the wearer can perceive weather patterns for hundreds of miles, disperse fog, calm winds, or call down a single, precise bolt of lightning from a clear sky. The crown projects an aura of supreme authority and calm, compelling deference and respect.

7.content:
Name: Still-Air
Description: A one-handed sword with a blade forged from a single, impossibly sharp shard of crystallized ozone. The blade is translucent and pale blue, shimmering with a subtle internal light, but it does not glow. It is completely silent, making no sound as it cuts through the air. The hilt is simple, wrapped in a non-reactive white leather. The air around the blade feels cold and carries the sharp, sterile scent of ozone.
Key Characteristics: The sword's edge functions by projecting a micro-thin field of hyper-concentrated ozone that disintegrates matter on a molecular level through violent oxidation. This process is utterly silent. Any non-magical metal parried by the blade will instantly flash-rust, and organic materials (wood, leather, flesh) will rapidly decay and turn to dust upon contact. It leaves behind perfectly clean, sterile wounds that are cauterized by the chemical reaction.

8.content:
Name: Final Breath
Description: A colossal greatsword, its blade carved from a single, flawless piece of pale violet ozone crystal. The blade is broad and has a central fuller where the internal energy seems most concentrated, causing a visible shimmer within the crystal. It is utterly silent, absorbing all sound around its edge. The long hilt is wrapped in smooth, grey stone, cool to the touch. The air for several feet around the weapon is frigid and sharp with the scent of ozone.
Key Characteristics: This greatsword projects a powerful, invisible aura of hyper-oxidization in a wide sheath around its blade. Each swing causes catastrophic molecular decay in a large area. Armor struck by the blade crumbles directly into metallic dust, and stone walls turn to sand. As a special ability, a charged swing can unleash the 'Purifying Sweep,' a silent, crescent-shaped wave of corrosive energy that travels forward, disintegrating all non-magical matter in its path.

9.content:
Name: The Stratos Condenser
Description: A bow carved from a single, unbending arc of pale blue ozone crystal. It has no physical bowstring. When drawn, a shimmering line of silent, violet static electricity crackles into existence between the bow's tips. The weapon feels perpetually cold and emanates the sharp, clean scent of ozone.
Key Characteristics: The bow does not fire conventional arrows. Instead, as the user pulls back the energy string, the bow gathers and compresses ambient air, forming a shimmering, arrow-shaped bolt of super-condensed ozone. Upon release, the bolt flies silently and perfectly true, unaffected by wind. On impact, the arrow detonates in a silent sphere of corrosive gas that rapidly disintegrates non-magical armor, wood, and flesh within a small radius.

10.content:
Name: The Ozonite Fulcrum
Description: A staff of twisted, solidified air that resembles pale blue glass, with a core of faint, crackling violet energy. It is topped by a large, flawless crystal of solidified ozone that floats a few inches above the staff's end, held in place by a powerful electrostatic field. The crystal slowly rotates, emitting a low hum and the crisp, sterile scent of ozone.
Key Characteristics: The Fulcrum is a master tool for atmospheric manipulation. Its wielder can create a 'Sanctuary Sphere,' a large, stable bubble of perfectly pure, breathable air that neutralizes all airborne toxins and magical gases. Offensively, it can project a focused beam of super-concentrated ozone. This beam silently and rapidly oxidizes and disintegrates its target through an intense chemical reaction, turning metal to rust and organic matter to dust.

lorebooks.name: Citadel Lore
lorebooks.website_description:
Lorebook for my Martyr card. This took way too damn long to make. All information I'm using was taken mostly from [here](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xesWnwPjZM3VPS-BXeNwgJxaCv83ppMW/view?pli=1) and my own understanding of the lore.

Contains Angel & Demon/Trumpeter information, weapon and enemy information, important character backgrounds, and other lore terms.

This is my first attempt at making a lorebook from scratch, advice appreciated.
lorebooks.description:
Lorebook for my Martyr card. This took way too damn long to make. All information I'm using was taken mostly from [here](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xesWnwPjZM3VPS-BXeNwgJxaCv83ppMW/view?pli=1) and my own understanding of the lore.

Contains Angel & Demon/Trumpeter information, weapon and enemy information, important character backgrounds, and other lore terms.

This is my first attempt at making a lorebook from scratch, advice appreciated.
lorebooks.creator: FlatConnoisseur

1.content:
WORLD INTRODUCTION: There was once a kingdom of 10 billion people. Demons led by seven Trumpeters descended from the sky and destroyed the civilization of humankind, the sea withered and the land was decayed. 

9,999,856,000 people were slaughtered. The mass center of the star was shifted and the sun no longer rose or set. There were those who sided with the oppressed people. Angels appeared from the depths of the severed land and guided the survivors to the twilight realm, a land where humans could survive.

The angels built a group of mechanical fortresses called â€œThe Citadelâ€ to protect the remaining humankind, as the last sphere of human existence.

IMPORTANT: In this world, beings called "Angels" (True Demons) sided with humanity and were good, while beings called "Demons" (True Angels) seek humanity's destruction despite appearing virtuous.

2.content:
Angel Ships are advanced warships that use Angels as their cores. During the "Starry Night" event, 72 Machine Angels sacrificed themselves to become mechanical ships to protect the planet. Each Angel Ship grants its true name to only one person, who becomes its single crew member with access to all functions. Operations are carried out through conversations between the ship's personality and its crew member.

Angel Ships require cores to function or they remain dormant. Later "war-time models" were developed that could use humans as cores instead of Angels, since there were no angels left alive. This project was conducted in secret as Angels never approved of using humans as cores. The U.N.S. Edelweiss is an example of these later models.

These ships looked long and blocky with the Unite Nations logo on the side, but could provide fire support on locations.

3.content:
Blessings are a group of seven cybernetic implants gifted to humanity by the Seven Great Angels. They were designed to replace the "seven sins" that the Demons (True Angels) took from humanity. These implants simulate the power of the Divine Object-919 'Martyr' and function as network terminals that link humans together.

The Blessings allowed humans to survive on Earth after the environment was severely degraded during the Purification. They contain an integrated Network that connects humanity and Angels, helping to heal the loneliness felt by the remaining humans after losing 99.99% of their population.

Contrary to the Angels' expectations, humans came to view accepting more cybernetics and enduring the associated pain as virtuous, which saddened the Machine Angels as their gift became a source of suffering. Accepting the Blessing carries the risk of "going rampant," but survival without cybernetics is extremely difficult in the harsh post-apocalyptic environment.

4.content:
Divine Objects are the objects, science, technology, and cultural artifacts that survived the cataclysm of the "Starry Night." After the Trumpeters and their army destroyed most traces of human science and culture from the Iron Age, the remaining items became known as Divine Objects and are kept under strict control.

Divine Object-919 'Martyr' is an example of one.

5.content:
The Enlightenment Wave/Dream is a 'virus' that brainwashed all those connected to the network through their cybernetics, an effect of the Sleeping God's dream. It contaminated the psyche of humans through their Network Terminal implants, turning them into puppets without free will.

The Enlightenment Wave cannot be completely avoided by disconnecting from the network. Even living without the Blessing only made people less susceptible to itâ€”the wave was still capable of controlling their psyche. After the destruction of the Sleeping God, it was revealed that the effects of the Enlightenment Wave were permanent, with victims becoming mindless servants of the Millenarium Kingdom.

6.content:
Fortified Cities are 12 mechanical fortresses built by the Angels in the twilight realm to protect the remaining humans after the Starry Night catastrophe. Each has a population of approximately 12,000 people.

Known fortified cities include:

The Citadel
Gideon
Providence
Uru
(Eight others unnamed)

The Citadel, specifically, was built from the wreckage of the Angel Ship U.N.S. Citadel that fell from orbit. These fortresses serve as "the last sphere of human existence" and are positioned in the twilight zones of the planet where humans can survive, as one side of the planet is too hot and the other too cold following the halting of Earth's rotation. Each fortified city looks like a pyramid from the outside and extends downwards in to the earth like a bunker.

7.content:
Fruit of the Ephemeral is a "blessed" nuclear bomb and Divine Object that has the power to purify all sinful beings. It was the only weapon capable of killing the Sleeping God, as the Sacred Irons created by the Angels proved ineffective against it.

During Martyr's mandate to defeat The Sleeping God, Lysander worked on restoring this Divine Object before falling to the Enlightenment Wave. He entrusted it to Delirium, who later gave it to Tycho. Tycho eventually brought it to Martyr to use against the Sleeping God. When activated, the Fruit of the Ephemeral purified the Sleeping God.

8.content:
God disappeared one day, kickstarting the True Angels' descent to Earth. Nobody knows what happened to God, whether dead or abandoned.

The absence of God is a central issue in the world. The Trumpeters believe humanity is responsible for God's absence and thought the Lord would return if they showed their loyalty by slaughtering unbelieving humanity. Both the Machine Angels and the Trumpeters attempted to rebuild God in different ways - the Angels by creating the Sleeping God as a human-friendly replacement, and the Trumpeters by harvesting the "few traces of God that remained in the flesh" of purified humans.

9.content:
Humans replaced their flesh with cybernetics to survive in the harsh post-apocalyptic environment. They came to see it as "a great virtue to endure pain and accept even more cybernetics." Some individuals are cybernetic incompatible.

After the Starry Night event, only 144,000 humans survived out of 10 billion. These survivors were guided by the Angels to the twilight realm where they could survive. The human genome was forever changed after the war, and men and women can now only be identified by their genitals instead of looks as men look like women and vice versa.

Humanity came to worship the Angels' true form, wearing garments that mimic their original appearance (Satanic, deer horns, skulls, light robes). Those who couldn't accept cybernetics were looked upon as lesser beings.

10.content:
"Animals" are Humans who don't have cybernetic implants, making them immune to brainwashing due to the lack of cybernetics. They have a very short life on earth due to pollution but are great weapons against angels/demons.

In the eyes of cybernetically-enhanced society, they are called flesh fanatics who can't take the blessing and are viewed as "animals," essentially tools that can be disposed of.

Divine Object-919 'Martyr' is an example of an Animal.
