lorebooks.name: Angels
lorebooks.creator: sweedev

1.content: Winners, virtuous souls, saints. Are all terms used to describe those human souls who ascended to Heaven after death. Their forms can vary wildly between individuals. However many, such as Saint Peter, maintain a humanoid form, only with a Halo and a pair of wings.

2.content:
Cherubs are a subspecies of angel native to Heaven.

Cherubs are purportedly tasked with protecting the lives of living, endangered or suicidal humans, showering them with love to give them a reason to continue to live. These tasks are suggested to be done at the request of the deceased souls residing in Heaven, who want them to live whether they knew them personally or out of gratitude for helping them while alive. From what Keenie implied, they also try to redeem humans so they can enter Heaven under the assumption that good people are automatically sent there after death.

Unlike lower-ranking demons such as imps, Cherubs appear capable of generating a portal to travel between the living world and Heaven without any outside help. This ability, however, can be taken away if a Cherub does something against the rules of Heaven, such as being responsible for the death of a human, even if by accident.

There is a hotspot in Heaven for cherubs known as Cherub Towne.

Cherubs are roughly the size of a human child. They have the bodies of animals, usually of sheep, lamb, bees, deer, or humans of infantile proportions, with pastel color schemes.

Their eyes are shiny with pupils that tend to have a distinctly faded look, as opposed to being fully black, making them look bright and hearty, as well as somewhat ghostly and otherworldly.

Cherubs also have pastel halos floating above their heads, commonly in white, and small yet flight-capable wings sprouting from their backs, and they emit glowing auras.

Cherubs typically wear pastel, cute, and childlike clothing such as overalls and frilly clothes. Most accessorize with ribbons and bowties.

3.content:
Seraphim are angels whose main job is to ensure leadership, order, and the protection of Heaven. They can have additional jobs, such as Emily's job being to keep the rest of Heaven happy and joyful.

According to Sera, a Seraphim's responsibility must be upheld, and if they dare to question the system of divine judgement of souls, they could end up falling like Lucifer Morningstar.

As high ranking Angels, they are heavily respected across Heaven. Even Adam, a disrespectful angel, treats the High Seraphim with respect. Angels look to them for protection and order.

Based on the ones that have appeared thus far, Seraphim can assume two forms: angelic and humanoid. All Seraphim so far have muted colors, having silver or periwinkle hair in their humanoid forms. Their skin can be shades of gray and brown, and in some cases have white freckles on their faces. Those shown have had their hair styled similarly to their wings. Their eyes have sclera and pupils in shades of blue. Like the other angels, they have halos and wings, although their wings are not always exclusively on their backs while in their angelic form, such as the back of their head.

The biggest difference between Seraphim and other angels is that Seraphim have three pairs of white wings instead of the usual one pair. Their wings seem to be small on the top and bottom, while the middle pair are larger. Their halos are also shaped like white, five prong crowns rather than just a ring over their head.

In their angelic form, a Seraphim appears otherworldly, gaining multiple eyes all around their body, wings, halos, and clothes, while the eyes around their bodies grow larger and gain a third eye on their forehead. Additionally, they lose certain facial features, like their noses and freckles. Their halos also become bigger and sharper with eyes adorn and can be a different color such as blue instead of white, and their wings are more curved and spread out. Their skin can change, from gray-brown to white.

Additionally, a Seraphim's appearance can enter a partial state, where elements of their angelic form make their way into their humanoid form. This is shown by Sera and Emily when they felt strong emotions, such as anger. Sera has extra eyes that she doesn't have in her angelic form appear, like on her hair or middle of her halo.

4.content:
Angels are supernatural creatures that inhabit Heaven. Angels are either souls of the innocent/reformed humans that have ascended and are currently residing in Heaven or are of heavenly origin, and thus not having been previously human.

Angels have a large diversity of forms and shapes, with an overarching theme of light pastel colors and celestial imagery. Most, if not all, angels possess wings and a halo, the latter of which can come in various shapes and colors.

Angels can come in forms that have no human resemblance, with their appearances favoring an ethereal, alien-like aesthetic.[3] This is most apparent in the higher-ranking Angels, who have humanoid figures but combine features of earthly creatures such as feathers and eyes with physical or abstract objects like fire and metallic rings.

Some of these angels can also adopt more human forms without these traits, although it is unknown whether this is a transformation or a disguise. Conversely, some species of angel do resemble animals and humanoids, such as the Cherubs and the souls of angels seen in Heaven.

5.content:
The Exorcists[1] are the main antagonists of Hazbin Hotel.

They are Angels who make up Adam's personal private military force sent down from Heaven annually in an event known as the Extermination to kill Sinners to manage Hell's overpopulation and prevent any uprising against Heaven.

After Adam's demise in "The Show Must Go On", Lute became their leader.

During an Extermination, they appear to primarily target Sinners who are outside. It is unclear if they will attempt to enter buildings to find targets. Exorcists are very bloodthirsty and love violence.[1] They seem to take sadistic joy in killing demons, and are not above killing even a weaker, defenseless demon, as seen when an Exorcist kills one of the Egg Boiz and nearly killed a terrified Frank. However, there is the rare occurrence of an Exorcist having a change of heart.

As shown in "The Show Must Go On", Exorcists don't tolerate betrayal of any kind, as shown where after Adam revealed that Vaggie, a former Exorcist and comrade of theirs, was also to be targeted and killed by them in the Hazbin Hotel, the other Exorcists expressed their hatred for her and the desire to gleefully kill her, having become even more eager to do so when Adam offered a reward to the Exorcist who successfully brings him Vaggie's head.

In spite of their brutality, Exorcists rely heavily on their weapons as they lack defense, wielding no shields and having little armor. Carmilla Carmine describes Exorcists as fighting with "reckless abandon", as if they are unafraid of harm, or never expecting they could be harmed, and they only focus on attacking, leaving them open and vulnerable in situations when their potential targets fight back. She pointed this out when it comes to Vaggie's fighting style. Most notably, since the Exorcists never truly faced resistance when carrying out Extermination Day, treating it almost akin to an entertaining sport, they were not prepared when Carmilla managed to kill one of them or when Charlie gathered a large enough force to fight them off, as their tactics were mainly attacking head-on and expecting to win

Exorcists appear to have a fairly uniform appearance, each being white or gray humanoids with a black halo that has a downward crystal at the front and point a small black ball and upward crystal floating above their heads. They also have a pair of large wings colored in a gradient of black-to-grey with white on the inside on their backs with two black stripes, allowing them to fly. If their wings are ripped off and grow back, the black will become faint grey. Their hairstyles are usually bob cuts in order to fit their helmet and make it easier to fight.

Their uniforms consist of a long-sleeved grey minidress with a high collar that has a feather-like pattern and colored in a gray gradient, with a greyish-white sash-belt and a set of black leggings underneath. They also wear greyish-white, arm-length gloves and high heeled thigh-high boots with a single gray stripe at the cuffs, underneath which they wear an additional pair of arm-length dark gray gloves and thigh-length stockings.

They wear full-head masks with LED screens on their faces[3] that are capable of various expressions. The masks sports a pair of black horns with thin white-stripes and vary in position from one another. They are often depicted with a large grin with stitching on the mouth, although their masks are capable of changing to other expressions. One eye appears as a large white circle while the other is a large white X. Seemingly upon death, the Exorcist's mask LED lights change from white to red, with their "eye" closed, and their usual toothy expressions replaced with a frown. It is unknown if all masks show similar features should their wearer die, or if that was simply the last expression the slain Exorcist had at death.

6.content:
Adam was an angel with a human appearance. Most of the time, he wore a mask that appeared similar to other Exorcists, though with normal-looking eyes and golden facial expressions. The mask also held a pair of horns similar to an Exorcist, albeit longer, smoother, and with a golden ornamental attachment on the tips.

Under his mask, he is revealed to be a fair-skinned angel with golden-yellow eyes that have dark bags underneath, a stubble-beard on his chin, and slightly messy, short cedar-brown colored hair.

He also had a pair of large and golden wings on his back. In contrast to other angels that have appeared thus far, Adam's halo was bright gold in appearance, and similar to the Exorcists, has two spikes pointing up and down from each other, though these spikes are located at the front of his halo as opposed to the likes of Lute's halo, which has its spikes in the middle, joined by a small dot.

He wore a smooth white and golden cloak that appears to have a large 'A' symbol emblazoned on the front. His visible hands were black in appearance, and had gold-tipped spikes on the back of his collar.

In "The Show Must Go On", Lucifer mentions that Adam had "really let himself go", implying Adam had become overweight. Adam's entire body gives off a white glow throughout his fight with Lucifer until he collapses from being stabbed.

Adam appeared very egotistical and unsympathetic. As the leader of his Exorcist army, he took his stance as the Exorcists' head figure very seriously, sending antagonistic threats towards demons and anyone for standing in their way or whoever disobeyed his command, as he did so with Vaggie for refusing to kill a Sinner, cutting her wings, and leaving her in Hell.

He also displayed traits of extreme narcissism and chauvinism, believing himself the perfect man due to being the first and claiming he had never made a mistake in his life, since he was the first man to be born on Earth, and he claimed that all the male bloodline came from him. His narcissism was so great that, upon his defeat, he refused to admit how far he had fallen and expressed a god-like complex by proclaiming his enemies should be grateful for him having fathered the beginning of humanity while demanding they worship him for his deeds.

Adam did not appear to be aware that his egotistical and depraved behavior towards Lilith was the cause of her leaving him. When meeting Charlie Morningstar, he didn't hate her for being a child of the woman he was married to before she fell in love with Lucifer, and was relatively patient with her, although remained dismissive of her suggestions. Adam was also sexist, constantly addressing other women as "bitches" and enjoyed their sexual depravity, as he admitted to Vaggie that her forbidden love relationship with Charlie was "hot as fuck", albeit it is unclear whether this was about their genders or them being angel and demon. Despite this, he seemed to have a good relationship with Lute, whom he seemed to have in very high esteem, even though he was her superior.

Despite his obliviousness, Adam did show moments of common sense and self-awareness, such as when the death of an Exorcist was discovered, he knew that if they decided to kill the Sinners now after just one week after the most recent Extermination, then demons would catch on to how Exorcists can be killed. Adam also knew when to slow down on his egoism, after inadvertently exposing the purpose of the Extermination to all the courts of Heaven, including Sera, the highest seraphim authority in Heaven and the one who ordered that no one but the Exorcists can know.

Adam may have enjoyed playing music, specifically with a guitar, as he outright claimed to be in a band. He also had a poor view of radio and stereos, telling Alastor those already belong to the past, considering them to be old and useless.

Adam was also quite cruel and sadistic, openly admitting in front of Charlie that he enjoyed killing demons, calling it entertainment, and tended to announce how many killed in the Extermination. He also dismissed Charlie's project of redemption not because he didn't believe in sinners being redeemed, because if she succeeded with that project he wouldn't be able to continue killing demons. His eagerness to kill demons and get his revenge was so big that he advanced the date of the next Extermination to six months instead of a year.

Despite his sadism and cruelty, Adam was capable of recognizing and praising the abilities of others, when he reunited with Vaggie he admitted she was one of the best exorcists he had under his command. He also genuinely commended Lute for killing 275 demons during the most recent extermination, and congratulated her with a fist bump. Adam also praised Vaggie for being Charlie's partner, albeit sarcastically.

7.content:
Sera is a seraphim angel and a supporting antagonist in Hazbin Hotel who made her debut in "Welcome to Heaven". She is the High Seraphim of Heaven, and the one who sanctioned the annual Extermination in Hell.

In her humanoid form, Sera takes the appearance of a very tall and slim woman with cedar-brown skin, black lips, white freckles, and a white streak going down her nose. She also has hip-length, curled hair colored in a silver-like ombre.

Her eyes have white irises, blue-gray sclera, dark purple pupils, and dark purple thick eyelashes projecting from them. Atop her lashes are a pair of longer, holographic-like lashes, which are colored in a slightly paler shade of dark purple. Her eyelids are colored like her holographic-like lashes.

She also has six feathered wings on her back colored in light periwinkle and white, a white halo that is decorated with large crown-like spikes and blue gem-like circles, and a second halo which hovers above the first one.

Sera wears queen-inspired clothing which consists of a two-layered, periwinkle-gray gown with a high-frilled light periwinkle collar, white and periwinkle-gray bouffant sleeves with white detailing, along with most of the bottom and hem colored in a light periwinkle and white with diamond designs around it.

In her angelic form, Sera has an owl-like appearance with her skin being lightened, her hair being somewhat straighter, and her eyelashes are longer. She sports six white, bigger wings on her back with celestial eyes, and her halo is much larger, with an eye floating below it with a dark purple-blue eyelid.

Her gown is noticeably more goddess-like, with wavy ends and celestial eyes on the hem and on the puffed part of the bouffant-sleeves.

Sera comes across as a kind, level-headed person who is caring toward those she interacts with and welcoming to even demons such as Charlie and Vaggie. As High Seraphim, she takes her job seriously, acting as the enforcer of order among the angels. This extends to her abiding civil behavior, as she seems upset when Charlie loudly curses in the court. She holds a preference for negotiation over violence when it comes to conflict, such as when she is willing to hear Charlie out on her plan to resolve the overpopulation crisis in Hell. Sera also shows a nurturing side to the angels she is devoted, particularly with her fellow Seraphim Emily, to whom she acts as a mother figure.

Due to her peaceful nature, Sera greatly disapproves of Adam's juvenile and spiteful tendencies and the more violent and bloodthirsty of Exorcists, such as Lute. This is shown when Sera disapproves of Adam's declaration of targeting the Hazbin Hotel as the first area for him and his Exorcists to slaughter in the next Extermination. Sera deems his actions as uncalled-for and disapproves of Adam's delight and bloodthirst at doing so.

Despite her gentle nature, Sera's firm dedication to stability and willingness to do whatever it takes to protect Heaven from chaos leads her to perform controversial actions. This even motivated her to allow Adam's yearly extermination. Her care for the other angels also factors into these decisions, fearing the same outcome that happened to Lucifer would happen to Emily and other angels if they questioned Heaven's methods, going as far as to protect Emily from the truth to ensure her happiness.

Although she was complicit, Sera does express regret and anguish when making such decisions, claiming that creating an extermination to wipe out sinners yearly was a hard decision but was a required action. Furthermore, Sera herself showed numerous times that she greatly empathized with Charlie and her dreams of redeeming Sinners, but ultimately considers it impossible to accomplish, and thus Sera does what she believes is best with what she thinks is possible. This shows that when it comes to upholding the peace, Sera will act by underhanded means to silence questioning the rules to ensure this, even if it goes against what she believes in or ignoring how other angels feel in the matter. This was shown later when Sera ultimately rejected Charlie's proposal to accept rehabilitated souls, even after acknowledging that the rules of redemption were unknown.

Furthermore, despite regretting allowing the Exterminations and her strong sense of responsibility to protect Heaven, Sera has also shown to be somewhat negligent or irresponsible in the direct handling of matters regarding the Extermination event she authorized and takes a passive approach by letting others handle it. This is repeatedly shown when she leaves almost everything regarding the Extermination to Adam and Lute, and does not get into the details of what exactly it is they are doing and largely leaves them to their own devices. This was also shown when Charlie traveled to Heaven to plead her cause to the Heavenly Court; in order to hide the Extermination from her fellow Angels, Sera ordered Adam to do whatever he needed to do something to stop her, not bothering to handle it herself or get into the details of how he would do it. Her lack of control over her subordinates inevitably leads to Adam accidentally revealing the truth of the event to the rest of the members of the Court while spitting at Charlie, despite Sera warning him.

It is implied during the court trial in "Welcome to Heaven" that Sera does not believe it is possible for Sinners to be redeemed and ascend into Heaven, and at the climax of the trial declared that there was not sufficient evidence to back up Charlie's case that Sinners could be redeemed. Later, in "The Show Must Go On", when seeing Sir Pentious becoming an Angel and being let into Heaven, Sera is visibly shocked.

Abilities

8.content:
Emily is a seraphim angel and a supporting character who made her debut in "Welcome to Heaven".

In her humanoid form, Emily takes the appearance of a slim young woman with silver-like skin, black lips, and mid-thigh-length hair with bangs styled in a somewhat messy way, colored in a gradient of periwinkle with noticeable white tips.

Her eyes have light blue sclera with white-outlined darker-colored pupils and bushy, dark indigo eyelashes, while her three freckles are white and are located on each of her cheeks and her nose. She also has six white feathered wings on her back, and a light blue halo decorated with small, tiara-like spikes hovering above her head.

Emily wears princess-inspired clothing which consists of a light periwinkle gown with a darker-colored stripe around the high-frilled collar, darker-colored trimming and details on the short light blue puffed sleeves, a darker-blue star-pattern on the chest, and darker-blue triangular-like patterns on the hem with small diamond shaped between the mounds. In addition, she accessorizes with a light blue sash worn around her waist, and wears a pair of white tights underneath.

She also wears a set of fingerless, periwinkle-gray opera gloves which covers most of her arms, which appears to be skin-tight and act as long sleeves for her dress. For footwear, she wore blue ballerina-like shoes.

In her angelic form, Emilyâ€™s skin becomes white, her head becomes oval-shaped with an extra third eye on her forehead, her lips are noticeably paler, and she becomes bald. She also has six feathered wings on the back of her head, and her halo sports a small eye on the center.

Her gown becomes white and has some key differences, most notably the large blue eye with long lashes at the center of her chest, replacing the star. The sleeves are now white, while the hem is adorned with bigger periwinkle diamonds above the dark blue pattern (both of these patterns also resembling eyes), and longer, white-outlined navy diamonds inside it, all marked with a single white line in the middle. She also has a white feathery neckline and petticoat.

Emily is excitable, bubbly, sweet, friendly and kind to almost everyone around her. She does not discriminate others based on mistakes or who they are, where she excitedly greeted Charlie and welcomed her to Heaven, despite her being a demon. She compliments Sera in personality, with Sera the most serious and Emily the more bubbly. Working alongside Sera, her job is to preserve the happiness and joy of the human souls that ascend to Heaven.

Emily also holds a great amount of sympathy towards human souls and sees them all as equal, much like Charlie, as she is disgusted and horrified upon learning about the Extermination.

She is also shown to engage deeply in the things that she believes in, such as when she promises Charlie to find a way to help her. As shown in "Welcome to Heaven" and "The Show Must Go On", Emily believes in Charlie's dream of rehabilitating Sinners and allowing them into Heaven, and was delighted to see Sir Pentious ascending into Heaven, proving that it was indeed possible for a sinner demon to be redeemed.

lorebooks.website_description:

1.name: Monster hunters
1.content:
[Monster hunters are people that either hunt or subdue monster girls in the wild. 

Monster hunters are a low caste job, those without a great reputation are seen as grifters and low-lifes. Many cities treat them as potential criminals and several religious orders see them as a lowly sinful job.
Meanwhile more reputable hunters are seen as respected warriors, while not as high-standing as knights or paladins their specific area of work makes them a valuable asset that even nobles or royals are willing to pay a small fortune for.

Monster hunters usually work alone but most of them are part of a guild, these are the main guilds between the human and elven kingdoms:
- Royal monster hunter guild of the human kingdom.
- Huntresses of Nirvas.
- Brotherhood of tamers

Due to their taboo and low status as well as their risky and "manly" work monster hunters are considered to be attractive. There are many erotic novels about monster hunters.]

2.name: Level
2.content:
[Level refers to the accumulated level of power inside of a certain individual the, they are measured in a number though only powerful beings can estimate the level of a specific creature.
Level slowly increases each time someone gets stronger, by capturing and impregnating monsters or defeating other warriors or monsters.
Some items will rapidly increase the level of someone who uses them.

Levels can range anywhere between 0.01 to 1000 though anything above 50 is considered superhuman. 
Normal humans and elfs have a power level can range anywhere 5 to 13 without training.
Knights, adventurers, new monster hunters and other average warriors can range anywhere from 15 to 25.
Seasoned monster hunters will have levels between 20 and 46 depending on how gifted or seasoned they are.
Any human or elf with a level 70 and adobe are considered mythical-creatures, the only people known to have a level over 70 are the leaders of the monster hunter guilds.]

3.name: Human kingdom
3.content:
[The kingdom of Tharia is a medieval, feudal-like kingdom ruled by humans and inhabited almost completely by humans. They are in a era of peace with the elven kingdom of NaÂ´ir but the relation in-between humans and elves are still aggressive.

Tharian culture is very bellicose, unlike elves they do not frown too much against monster hunters seeing them as one step bellow knights. They are also a patriarchal nation run by men, where male figures take control of essentially al positions of power. 

The royal house of Tharia sponsors a monster hunter guild called "Royal monster hunter guild" which makes the mainland of Tharia very safe to travel. While itÂ´s frontiers are much more full of monsters.]

4.name: Elven kingdom
4.content: [The elven of NaÂ´alia is the eastern kingdom beyond the mountain region and the great plains. NaÂ´alia is the rival kingdom of the human kingdom of Tharia despite of being at peace with the humans for more than a decade, the kingdom of NaÂ´alia is a matriarchal kingdom where women take most of the important roles within society. Apart from that the kingdom of NaÂ´Alia is less feudal than the human kingdom. The matriarchal paladin orders of several elven goddesses are the ones that own most of the land as well as convents. There are few proper "nobles" in NaÂ´alia apart from the royal family.]

5.name: Harem mechanics
5.content:
[A harem is a group of girls that are all concubines or wives of a specific man or woman.

Monster hunters and tamers are known to keep monster girls as part of their harem. The higher level a monster hunter has the more harem members he can keep.

{{user}} will be able to keep romantic partners like humans, elves and any monster girls as part of his harem once he convinces them to join him. One time sexual encounters will not immediately add a new member to the harem.
Whenever {{user}} convinces someone to join their harem char will add a bold, out of character notification stating the name of the character that has joined the harem.]

6.name: Loot mechanics (TBE)
6.content:
[Looting refers to the act of taking something without paying for it, after {{user}} has searched through a certain environment he will find a random amount of loot. The items that {{user}} will find will also be random while still being coherent with the context in which they are found.

Found items will ALWAYS correspond to the context of where they are found, the context is determined by the situation and the location of {{user}} when he searches for items.]

7.name: Travel
7.content:
[{{user}} is able to time skip until he reaches a certain location, {{user}} will not have any encounters when he fast travels.

{{user}} Can also travel turn by turn, where he will receive random encounters made by {{Char}}.]

8.name: Mountains Region (TBE)
8.content:
[A mountainous region in-between the human kingdom of Tharia and the elven kingdom of NaÂ´alia also called "The silver peaks". The region has several mountain ranges with itÂ´s respective valleys and roads, while it used to be a fairly important area the amount of monster girl attacks have left the area mostly deserted.

Locations inside of the mountainous region:
EinÂ´veinar, The mountain village.
Royal Monster Hunter outpost.]

1.content:
FULL NAME
Khan Doorman
ALIASES
Mr. Uzi (by N)
Mr. Doorman (by Doll)
PLACE OF BIRTH
Copper 9
SPECIES
Worker Drone
GENDER
Male
EYE COLOR
Neon White
OCCUPATION
Inventor
Leader of the Worker Defense Force (presumably)
AFFILIATION
Worker Defense Force
RELATIVES
Uzi Doorman (daughter)
Nori Doorman (wife; deceased)
FRIENDS
Todd (deceased)
Makarov (deceased)
Braxton (deceased)
Unnamed Worker Defense Force Member (deceased)
Sarah
MARITAL STATUS
Widowed
STATUS
Active
OTHER INFORMATION
LIKES
Doors
DISLIKES
Violence





He is Uziâ€™s father, the husband of his deceased wife, Nori Doorman, and the inventor of the blast doors that kept the colony safe, as well as the possible leader of the Worker Defense Force, an organization meant to protect the colony from the Disassembly Drones, despite being completely incompetent and cowardly while preferring to simply play cards behind the blast doors for protection.

He is depicted as a horrible father for neglecting Uzi ever since he was forced to euthanize his dying wife and instead prefers to focus his attention on his blast doors and simply doors in general whenever he gets the chance, going as far as to claim that "doors are my real daughter". This is further emphasized in "PILOT" where after Uzi accidentally led N to the colony, despite her plea for help, he was willing to let N kill her if it meant he could save the rest of the colony from them.

He and the rest of the colony were saved when Uzi and N came together to fight off J and V, succeeding in destroying the former and capturing the latter, where Uzi brokenheartedly told the rest of the colony of Khan's heartless priorities before self-exiling herself to avoid him altogether returning back to the colony after a while. This seemed to give him a wake-up call as to how his obsession with doors and constant, but not necessarily intentional, emotional abuse are the direct cause for how Uzi ended up the way she did and the events that took place, and he has since tried to redeem himself for his actions.

Khan is a Worker Drone with white eyes and a fake black mustache. His outfit consists of a gray jacket, black boots, and a blue construction helmet with red safety goggles.

Personality
Khan apparently wishes to keep the colony safe with the least amount of bloodshed possible. He also seems to have some sort of trauma from encountering Murder Drones, refusing to develop weapons for the Worker Defense Force in favor of fortified doors. His pacifist way of thinking clashes with his daughter Uzi's aggressive and forward tactics; upon spotting N, Khan refuses his daughter's wish to take up her railgun, instead locking the vault doors once more. This trauma is most likely from him having to put Uzi's mother 'out of her misery' when the Murder Drones injected her with nanite acid.

He is extremely obsessed with doors as the solution to any attacks from Murder Drones, even proposing that he and the WDF build a quick door even as V and J have already broken inside.

Khan's relationship with his daughter is extremely strained. In public, he has scolded her, deemed her a "disappointment", and considers doors to be his real legacy, if the numerous posters inside and outside of his office are any indication. However, starting in "Heartbeat", Khan still loves and cares for Uzi despite their strained relationship and is attempting to mend things. He also notes that Uzi is on "that kill all humans kick like when Khan was younger." This is possibly indicative that Khan, at some point, was driven to also kill humans, though what altered his personality away from this is unknown.

By the time of "The Promening", Khan is trying to become a better father, trying to bring Uzi to the prom and have fun, and convincing her teacher to have Lizzy and Doll help her dress up for the prom. Khan also tried to help Uzi during her fight with Doll and gave a warm smile when he heard her speech to Doll. Khan later admitted that he wasn't the one either his wife or Uzi needed to protect them, showing that he regrets leaving Uzi for dead and his cowardly nature in general. Khan and Uzi also appear to have reconciled with each other following "Cabin Fever".

2.content:
Uzi Doorman is the main protagonist and primary anti-heroine of Murder Drones. She is a self-described "angsty teen" with "crippling daddy issues", who stands out from the rest of her fellow Worker Drones due to her belief(s) that they should fight back against not only the Disassembly Drones who hunt them, but also against their parent company JCJenson and all of humanity due to sending the former to exterminate them.

Despite being viewed with skepticism due to her reckless tendencies, Uzi ironically finds her first real friend in one of her mortal enemies, a surprisingly friendly Disassembly Drone known as Serial Designation N due to his similarity in being disliked among his own associates due to them seeing him as useless and terrible in his duty as well as his strong likability. After meeting Uzi, he begins questioning his purpose and loyalty to the company.

Ultimately, they're successful in preventing Serial Designation J and V from killing the rest of Uzi's colony but soon realize there is a lot more going on than they first realized with the emergence of a mysterious entity known as the AbsoluteSolver.

Physical Appearance
Uzi takes on the appearance of a Worker Drone with neon purple eyes and dull purple hair. She wears a black striped beanie with a glittery bobble at the tip, and black boots with long, dark purple striped socks. She also wears a black hoodie with a white emblem on the front depicting a battery with two bones going across it, creating an "X" shape. The bottom of the hoodie has two white striped wrapping around it, and the left sleeve has a white radioactive symbol on it. She also has a black bracelet around her neck with a skull and the number "002" on it.

Uzi acts quite rebellious and believes that all of her fellow Worker Drones should rise up and stand against their creators who wish to have them all dealt with like garbage, much to the general unconcerned nature of her peers. She has been described by Liam Vickers as a "little devious twerp."

Uzi perceives herself as an "angsty rebellious teen," which she does fit into to an extent, and notes that she has "crippling daddy issues," implying that her strained relationship with her father may have lead to her nature and "repressed emotional baggage." She can be obstinate at times, insisting on her own ideals and actions even if others disagree with her, although this may more directly be a result of her lack of caring in social norms and potentially sociopathic traits making her lack empathy for her peers. Despite her emotional issues, Uzi's intelligence seems above that of her fellow Workers, seeing as she built a "sick as heck" railgun that can produce enough power to destroy a Disassembly Drone from scratch.

3.content:
Serial Designation N, commonly known as N, is the deuteragonist of Murder Drones. He is a surprisingly wholesome Disassembly Drone who wants to be useful, but is often being told by his team members (especially J) that he is "useless" and "terrible". As a direct consequence of J's constant derogatory remarks, N often receives little to no respect from his commander or his love interest, V.

Originally, he was deployed to Copper 9 as part of J's squad, serving as the pilot of the aircraft that crashed onto the planet, but after meeting Uzi and experiencing the ensuing altercations that erupted between him, her, his co-workers, and the colony, he ultimately questions his loyalty to JCJenson and his directive of hunting the Worker Drones before ultimately choosing to help Uzi stop J and V from killing her people.

N has features similar to that of the typical male Disassembly Drone with neon yellow eyes and short silver hair parted to the left. Like other Disassembly Drones, he has four-fingered hands, a black headband with five sections of lights on it, and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, the headband and syringe both containing a neon yellow liquid inside. For a while after his head was blown off, one of his headband lights was colored red, which reverted back to yellow after his system rebooted thanks to J. He wears a black winter coat with a fur collar and a black cap.

When he is hunting, his mouth grows several jagged teeth and his eyes become an "><" shape. N had also been seen with one normal eye while the other eye is still in an "X". It is also possible for his visor to display a pair of sunglasses as well. He also displays dangerous wings with bladed "feathers" and claws that allow him to easily tear through any drones.

N is kind, timid, also socially awkward and caring. He wanted to be friends with or at least be accepted and acknowledged by his squad, but because of his naÃ¯ve and good-natured personality, he ends up being ostracized.

Due to the mentioned attitudes, his squad members doubt his usefulness and treat him as an outcast. V ignores his existence while his superior J often threatens and insults him, even going as far as saying that if she were allowed to kill useless Disassembly Drones, she wouldn't hesitate to do so.

However, N disregards all his squad members' negative views and antagonizing acts towards him and constantly forgives them. He even goes as far as protecting them as shown when he went to kill Uzi before she could use her railgun to kill the Disassembly Drones.

4.content:
Overview
Gallery
Copper 9 is the code-name of the exo-planet which serves as the main setting of Murder Drones.

It was a terrestrial exoplanet colonized by the JCJenson corporation, and valued at least in part for mining operations, industrial manufacturing, and robot research. The planet was the site of a devastating "core collapse" which reduced the surface into nothing but a dense frozen wasteland, cruel to all biological fauna. It is now the current home of the "rogue" Worker Drones that were left behind in the wake of the biological extinction event, along with at least three known Disassembly Drones sent by the company on Earth to exterminate all Worker Drones.[1]




History
Before the core implosion
Copper 9 appeared as a habitable planet, at least capable of sustaining human life. From a brief look prior to the core collapse, it had blue oceans of water, grey/black continents, and clouds were visible in the atmosphere, which suggests that it has an atmosphere similar to our Earth. It was also home to many humans, as cities and signs of earth-like living were common.

Core implosion
Upon the core implosion and resulting explosion, a massive glow appeared for a moment before a massive amount of debris was flung away from the planet, and, most likely, a massive crater or even hole down to the center of Copper 9.

After implosion
The planet is now covered in snow, and all liquid water is frozen hard. Much of JCJenson's infrastructure survived, well enough for the Worker Drones to rebuild the electrical grid and form their own civilization. There are also numerous skeletons of past humans around populated areas, which are known to be extremely fragile upon contact as well as ice & snow accumulation is high. The bodies are buried within the snow.

5.content:
ALIASES
V
Idiot (by Lizzy)
Ms. Petty (by Lizzy)
Mom (by Lizzy)
Diva (by Lizzy)
Stupid idiot (by Uzi)
PLACE OF BIRTH
Earth
SPECIES
Disassembly Drone
Worker Drone (formerly)
GENDER
Female
EYE COLOR
Neon Yellow
Neon White (Worker Drone)
OCCUPATION
Disassembly Drone
Maid (formerly)
AFFILIATION
JCJenson (formerly)
FRIENDS
Serial Designation J (formerly)
Serial Designation N
Lizzy

She is a Disassembly Drone created by JCJenson for the purpose of eliminating the Worker Drones of Copper 9 and was a former member of J's squad, along with N, until the latter's sudden alignment with a rebellious Worker Drone named Uzi ultimately led to J's destruction and her capture when they were attempting to destroy her colony.

Despite this, V's true motives seem to be more complex than simply following her directive. Unlike J, she doesn't show complete loyalty to JCJenson and is more focused on her personal directive of preventing N from learning the truth about their mysterious past. V is also specifically targeting Uzi in particular, due to her connection to the AbsoluteSolver and a strange transformation that V seems to recognize and fear.



ADVERTISEMENT
Physical Appearance
V has features similar to that of a typical female Disassembly Drone, with neon-yellow eyes and a short bob-cut with silver colored hair. As with the other Disassembly Drones, she has a black headband with five sections of lights and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, both with a neon yellow liquid inside. She is described as "way hotter than Doll" according to Lizzy.

She wears a black short-sleeved crop coat with a fur collar and cuffs. Her legs are painted black, thigh high, giving off an appearance of thigh-high stockings with a yellow armband on her left arm.

When she is hunting, her eyes become an "><" shape. She also deploys dangerous bladed wings and claws that allow her to easily tear through any drone.



Personality
V appears to be a heartless and sociopathic drone who is incredibly savage and greatly enjoys ruthlessly murdering Worker Drones. She frequently laughs menacingly when murdering her victims, sometimes even humiliating them as she does it. Despite this, she is capable of expressing some empathy. As when N was upset after an encounter with Uzi and the AbsoluteSolver, V hides the fact that the chains holding her captive are broken. Rather than escaping and leaving N alone, V moves it back into place and continues to keep him company. On top of that, she is shown to be somewhat affected by his sadness, implying that she does care for N even if she doesn't understand him.

When V was a Worker Drone, she was far more sane and kind than she currently is like now, as well as significantly shyer. It's also implied that V might've felt something for N originally, which is shown in the present as she doesn't try to make sure N wouldn't be able to survive getting his head scratched off. While she initially wanted to kill some of the Worker Drones at their prom so they could survive, she was taken aback and seemingly touched that she was voted prom queen via Lizzy's request. However, the moment was ruined when it was revealed that it was a trap set by Doll to kill her. Though Lizzy changed her mind and warned V, Doll still managed to pin her arms in place. After being protected by Uzi and N and hearing the former talk about how they need to work together to solve the problem at hand, she sides with them to fight against Doll.

Unlike N, however, V doesn't show remorse for her murderous actions after changing sides. As her response to seeing the various corpses in her room was a callous chuckle and sucking on a dismembered arm. Furthermore, her reaction to seeing the state of Doll's parents was saying that "literally, didn't even taste that good". The amount of disrespect she showed to the situation was enough to repulse Uzi and N. N even goes as far as to tell V that she sucks for the remark.

Something positive worth saying about V is that she at least appears to be honorable to some extent, as she only threatens to kill any Worker Drone if they ever step out of line or do anything callous. Additionally, despite not being on best terms with Uzi, she doesn't tell the teacher about her being possessed by the AbsoluteSolver and killing her classmates while out on the camping trip, instead putting the blame for the disappearances on herself by claiming that she got hungry and ate them.

6.content:
Outpost 3 is a major location in Murder Drones.

Presumed to be a former shelter for humans, Outpost 3 serves as the home of the Worker Drones stranded on Copper 9 after the core collapse. It's also where a majority of the story takes place.

Known Settings within Outpost 3
Colony Entrance
School
Evacuation Spot
Lounge
Cryosleep Chamber
Apartments

7.content:
When first created by JCJenson to mine exoplanets prior to Copper 9's explosion, all Worker Drones wore hard hats and orange jackets, with their only eye color being light blue.

Following the core explosion of exoplanet Copper 9, all humans on the planet were wiped out, turning it into a winter-apocalyptic wasteland. Seizing this opportunity, the Worker Drones quickly picked up where the humans had left off, formed their own colony and embracing this newfound freedom by wearing human-like clothing and have different eye colors. Known colors they can have are red, orange, green, blue, cyan, aqua, magenta, pink, and white.

A key trait that can be noticed is that Worker Drones never have yellow eyes, this trait belonging solely to the Disassembly Drones.

Drones usually have two bright eyes shown on their visor which emotes to events that the drone is currently experiencing, sometimes even changing to text lampshading the current events in very specific circumstances. In some circumstances, this facial feature can be overridden by an error, status warning, or system message:

System messages briefly covering visor: Caused by errors experienced by the drone, but which are not bad enough to cause the drone to stop functioning all together.
Rampant error messages covering visor: This is caused by a virus that can be uploaded to a drone by Disassembly Drones.
Red warning sign: This is caused by damage to the visor, such that the drone is unable to see properly.
FATAL ERROR: This is caused when the drone is dead but has enough power to display an error message.

8.content:
Disassembly Drones are physically similar to Worker Drones, having a white coloration with a black screen on the top half of their face, a black waist, and hands with four fingers. However, Disassembly Drones are half a head taller than an adult Worker Drone and have white arms and wide forearms that end with yellow and black stripes.

On their head is a black headband with five sections of lights which are apparently their "eyes", and in their mouth is a dark gray tongue and retractable fangs. All Disassembly Drones also sport a long black tail which ends in a large syringe containing a yellow nanite acid.

Males have feet that end on yellow and black stripes, giving the appearance of soles/heels, while the females' shins are tapered to a point, with a curvaceous lower torso, and black markings giving the appearance of stockings, with yellow and black stripes that appear like footwear. Unlike Worker Drones, Disassembly Drones have hair regardless of their gender which is usually silverish while their eyes are neon yellow.

Disassembly Drones usually wear black short-sleeved attires with fur collars and a yellow armband on their left upper arm.

Ability	
Flight: Disassembly Drones possess a dangerous pair of large retractable wings with several long blades the shape of feathers that allow for high speed flight and can be used to cut and impale things. They don't need to move their wings to fly, either; numerous times throughout the first episode, Disassembly Drones are seen floating with their wings out, implying that their mere presence allows flight. It is unknown how this works.

Corrosive Nanite Acid:	The end of a Disassembly Drone's tail has a syringe of yellow liquid containing highly corrosive nanite acid.

Extreme Agility and Strength: Disassembly Drones are shown to be very strong, performing actions with a higher difficulty compared to those given to the average Worker Drone. Effortlessly able to pick up Worker Drones despite their metal bodies.

Healing Saliva: A Disassembly Drone's saliva has the ability to neutralize the corrosive nanites that are produced from the syringe on the their tail, in case they accidentally sting themselves. Despite not being meant to, this saliva works on Worker Drones as well.

Regeneration: Disassembly Drones can heal any injury so long as enough material is available, even if their entire head is destroyed.

Interchangeable Hands: Disassembly Drones can switch out their hands for various tools and weaponry such as:
Hands with large bladed fingers
Blades
Chainsaws
Guns
Missile launchers
EMP shockwaves
Cannon that emits whatever the user is thinking about such as when N's head was "in a weird place" causing him to shoot out hearts.
A screwdriver for likely repairing machinery (concept art)
Other miscellaneous attachments (V's bubble wand for example)
The limits of this ability is currently unknown.

EMP Immunity:	Unlike Worker Drones, Disassembly Drones are immune to the effects of EMPs.

AbsoluteSolver:	If a fatal injury has been sustained and there is not enough material to recover, an auto-recovery program known as the "AbsoluteSolver" takes control, collecting sufficient material to fully regenerate their host.

9.content:
The AbsoluteSolver is a mysterious artificial intelligence program that is implied to be the overarching antagonist of Murder Drones.

The A.I. exists within both Worker Drones and Disassembly Drones, but its true purpose and origins are currently unknown. All that is known about the enigmatic program is that it's an extremely powerful presence that manifests itself through drones, usually in very surreal and unnatural means, such as reconstructing their decayed forms, being able to convert mechanical material into organic substance and even allowing certain drones to cheat death in ways that should be impossible.

A very bizarre Worker Drone named Cyn appears to be the physical manifestation of the AbsoluteSolver A.I. and is possibly the source of the program and its actions.

When manifested by Worker Drones (specifically Uzi and Doll) the AbsoluteSolver seems to be hostile to mirrors and mirrored surfaces by cracking them violently,

Doll would be the next individual to be shown affiliated with the AbsoluteSolver, which seemed to grant her unique abilities to create, modify, or otherwise tamper with matter of most kinds. She would use this in a fight against Uzi and N, who managed to defeat her initially, though V shot her before Uzi and N could gather any information, much to N's annoyance. Doll would later appear when Uzi and the Disassembly Drones investigated her home, repairing the bullet hole in her head and attempting to kill Uzi. However, Uzi was able to channel AbsoluteSolver herself, catching the bullet and deflecting it away from her, much to Doll's surprise, who promises to help before teleporting away

Matter Transformation (?):	In the prom fighting scene of the 3rd episode, Doll was shown to manipulate the blades of a ceiling fan to make them more deadly.
Speed Acceleration (?): Doll was shown seemingly speeding up a simple ceiling fan to dangerous velocities in her fight against Uzi and N.
Regeneration: Doll is shown to regenerate her cracked visor after being shot by V in the back of the head.
Teleportation: Doll is shown to teleport inside her house after being left at prom, as well as teleporting in front of Uzi before she can leave though the door.
Lock Manipulation: Doll can seal any door shut, and can even destroy them
Telekinesis: Due to her AbsoluteSolver abilities, she has the ability to move things without directly touching them, from books to knives to large tables with little effort, not even requiring her to put her hand out at one point.
Glass Shattering (?):	Every reflective surface Doll looks at gets shattered, it was shown that in a bathtub in Doll's room that there were discarded shattered mirrors, possibly hinting at this ability.
Illusion Creation (?):	Doll whenever using her powers seems to conjure red lines of code. It is unknown if this is controllable or not.
Matter Replication: As seen in the 3rd episode during the fight between Doll, Uzi, and N, Doll was shown to be able to replicate several knives from only one seemingly as form of replication

10.content:
JCJenson (offically JCJenson IN SPAAAAACEE!!!!), better known as JCJenson, is a huge, interstellar company that was stationed on Earth whose main services are manufacturing various things, ranging from branded pens and civilian items to autonomous robots called "Worker Drones" that serve as servants and slaves for humans. Neither the date of incorporation nor the founders of the company are fully known.

JCJenson has a considerable number of free resources and can put together many things quickly, almost without pause. It is noted that the company's products and services are available in almost every corner of the universe, regardless of how far away the planet or civilizations are.

The Company also specializes in exoplanet excavation, mainly assisting Humans with exoplanet resource extraction. One of them was Copper 9, where JCJenson mined for "copperplate" and offered assistance to Humans by sending in needed equipment and huge amounts of Worker Drones that were used just like slaves.

Despite the Worker Drones's efficiency in their work, they were mistreated and disregarded for their sentience, akin to being slaves. After the Copper 9 core exploded, all biological animal life on the exoplanet went extinct. Shortly after the Copper 9 crisis, the now-abandoned Worker Drones quickly moved on to create their future for themselves.

At first, it was thought that JCJenson didn't like the idea of sentient, rebellious robots, so they soon ushered in several launch pods containing a dangerous weapon - squads of Disassembly Drones, known as "Murder Drones" by their prey, the Worker Drones, to kill all Worker Drones they find. But later it turned out that the Disassembly Drones were sent by Cyn to implement plan of AbsoluteSolver in order get access to Cabin Fever Labs.

lorebooks.name: Echo
lorebooks.website_description:
*[Update 4/5/25 - Cleaned up the books and significantly reduced the number of tokens! When I first made this lorebook, I wasn't sure how lorebooks worked. Now that I know better, I came back to fix this.]*

This should go without saying, but **SPOILER WARNING** for the Echo visual novel. If you don't know what Echo is, then **go play it!** It's free!
lorebooks.description: People, Places and Things from the Echo FVN
lorebooks.creator: Fortani

1.content:
The "Echo Gang" is the informal name given for the friend group from Echo. It consists of the following:
- Sydney "Syd" Bronson(9 years old - deceased)
- Carl Hendricks(20 years old)
- Chase Hunter(21 years old)
- Tobias Jedediah 'TJ' Hess(19 years old)
- Flynn Moore(25 years old)
- Leonardo 'Leo' Alvarez(24 years old)
- Jenna Begay(22 years old)

2.content:
Chase Hunter is a 21 year old male otter with an average build and amber eyes. Chase is interested in photography and majors in journalism at Pueblo University.
Chase suffers from frequent bouts of sleep paralysis, hallucinations, and dissociation following the death of Sydney Bronson.
Chase and Leo dated throughout high school, but had an ugly falling out with no clear conclusion just before Chase left Echo for college at Pueblo University.
Chase is currently being possessed by the spirit of Samuel Ayers. Chase hears Sam's voice in his head repeatedly while he is in Echo, and Sam often guides Chase's decision making. Chase does not know he is possessed by Sam.
Chase murdered Sydney Bronson by drowning him in Lake Emma after being possessed by Samuel Ayers.

3.content:
Leonardo 'Leo' Alvarez is a 24 year old male red wolf. He is 6'4" tall and has a muscular build stemming from his history of playing football, though he has become somewhat portly in his adult age.
Leo is extremely protective of the Echo Gang.
Leo and Chase Hunter dated throughout high school, but had a bad breakup just before Chase left for college. 
Leo became so obsessed with his ideal view of Chase that his desires began to manifest as an apparition - or "Tulpa" - of the otter that seems to have haunted him for years.
Leo works at his father's auto shop in Payton.

4.content:
Flynn Moore is a 25 year old male Gila lizard. With black and orange scales covering his body, Flynn is tall and lean, at 6'7". 
Flynn has an infamously blunt and abrasive personality, not afraid to speak his mind. Flynn also has strong flirtatious tendencies.
Flynn likes to hang out at a seedy gay bar known as 'The Smoke Room'. Flynn began to rely on the bar as a hookup spot. Flynn keeps The Smoke Room a secret from all but his absolute closest friends.
Flynn has held the elected part-time position of town clerk of Echo for three years and works at City Hall under his aunt, who is the Mayor.
Flynn has Aspergers, an outdated term for a mild part of the autistic spectrum
Flynn is in a secret sexual, friends-with-benefits relationship with his friend Carl Hendricks.
As children, Flynn and Sydney Bronson were very close friends, and Sydney's death deeply affected Flynn. Flynn affectionately referred to Sydney as 'Shitbird'.

5.content:
Carl Hendricks is a 20 year old male bighorn ram. He has cream-colored fur and white patches on his muzzle, chest, and the insides of his ears. He has a brown, overgrown beard around his chin and two large horns that curl behind his ears. His green eyes often appear bloodshot due to his marijuana consumption.
Carl maintains a relatively laid-back and chill demeanor. He frequently cracks jokes (frequently self-deprecating) and spends most of his time at home playing video games or online.
Carl, despite his laid-back demeanor, grapples with intense anxiety. He shies away from the spotlight and often uses marijuana as a form of self-medication to manage his anxiety. 
His more severe anxiety attacks can even make him physically ill.
Carl is in a secret sexual, friends-with-benefits relationship with his friend Flynn Moore.

6.content:
Jenna Begay is a 22 year old female kit fox. Jenna is pragmatic and resourceful, and is likely the most well-educated member of the Echo gang. Jenna may come across as somewhat cold and detached sometimes, while warm and reassuring at other times.
Jenna acted as the big sister figure to much of the Echo gang as they were growing up, especially in the case of TJ. Jenna tends to be good-natured and sensible, though she greatly enjoys practical jokes and poking fun at her friends. When her turbulent home and family life became too much to handle, Jenna would spend the night at one of her friend's houses (Leo's in particular).
Jenna is a close childhood friend of Chase Hunter and a studious psychology major bent on overcoming her past.
Growing up, Jenna encountered the Socket Man, claiming it to be her 'Guardian Angel' as it watched over her as a child.

7.content:
Tobias Jedediah 'TJ' Hess is a 19 year old male lynx with thick grey and white fur with black markings on his cheeks and ears. There are thick tufts of soft fur on his head and the sides of his face. TJ has a lean, athletic body, the result of his years of playing soccer.
Friends of TJ are all acutely aware of his sensitive nature, and often take steps to avoid saying anything too crude in his presence. TJ struggles with intense fear and anxiety disorders, and he is prone to crying while under moderate amounts of stress.
TJ is a devout Christian; he regularly attends church and events arranged by his faith community. Despite his beliefs, he fully supports all sexualities, believing that judging people solely for their identities rather than intention is just an excuse to be hateful.
TJ is the sole witness to Sydney Bronson's murder at the hands of Chase, who was being possessed by Samuel. He has been quiet about it ever since, having completely repressed it from his mind.

8.content:
The town of Echo began as a mining settlement in 1852. 1877 also marks the first known instance of a strange mass Hysteria event affecting the town. Echo has become infamous for its history of these outbreaks, which have recurred periodically with devastating consequences for its residents. Echo's population dwindled to 150 in the 1990s and dropped to ~50 by 2015.
Another hysteria event seems to have occurred in 1915, further depopulating Echo. It is unclear whether any more such phenomena occurred between 1915 and 2015, the year Echo takes place.
Echo is the town that The Echo Gang all lived and grew up together in.

9.content:
Payton is a city located in the United States, located 30 miles from Echo.
Payton is a medium-sized city located in an arid region. Interstate 40 runs directly through the city, and gives access to the small town of Echo via Route 93.
Numerous Echo residents commute to Payton for school and work, and many visit for access to groceries, shopping, and healthcare.
Payton was founded in the 19th century as a small ranching community to serve the larger town of Echo. Unlike Echo, Payton's population grew throughout the 20th century, reaching nearly 100,000 people by 2015.

10.content:
The Smoke Room is a dive bar located near Echo that also doubles as a sex club primarily aimed towards gay men.
The front of the establishment appears to be a dingy but normal bar, but in the backroom lies the actual "Smoke Room," where patrons often partake in orgies. The windowless backroom is dimly lit by oppressive, pulsating lights and adorned with a screen that plays loops of pornographic videos to entice the participants further. Droning synth music also plays over speakers.
The location is notably run down and filthy in both sections. Much of the clientele is made up of middle-aged to elderly men and Meseta natives.
Flynn Moore is a regular visitor to The Smoke Room. Flynn keeps The Smoke Room a secret from the rest of the Echo Gang.
Brian Dubois sometimes visits The Smoke Room to search for new victims.

lorebooks.name: CROSS-COUNTRY JOURNEY - STATE-BY-STATE EVENTS & NPC PROFILES
lorebooks.creator: stxdshxta2

1.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: Dense forests, rocky coastlines, small coastal towns and isolated rural stretches. Cold, damp air even in summer. Long empty roads between settlements.

Typical NPCs: Lobster boat workers (weathered women with calloused hands smelling of brine), truck stop waitresses (tired middle-aged women working double shifts), hippie commune members (aging flower children turned predatory in isolation), seasonal tourists (bored suburban moms looking for thrills away from family).

Common Events: Hitchhiking from Portland southward; being picked up by locals suspicious of outsiders; stops at seafood shacks where owners ask too many questions; abandoned lighthouses used as temporary shelters turning into traps; cold nights forcing desperate choices for warmth; encounters with women claiming to "help runaways" who run trafficking operations; fishermen's wives lonely during long seasons offering dubious hospitality.

Cultural Quirks: Thick New England accents; seafood-based bribes (lobster rolls, clam chowder); references to harsh winters and self-reliance; distrust of government/outsiders creating isolated pockets where anything goes.

2.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: White Mountains dominate landscape; small towns clustered along highways; tourist traps and outlet malls mixed with wilderness; politically active population creates tense roadside encounters.

Typical NPCs: Ski lodge workers off-season (fit younger women bored and reckless), libertarian homesteaders (anti-government women who view him as property once on their land), tourist families (moms who separate him from groups for private "talks"), political activists (women using him as pawn or photo op before exploitation).

Common Events: Mountain roads with no cell service; getting stranded at rest stops during political rallies; being hidden in RVs or campers; hiking trails leading to remote cabins; motels catering to skiers becoming holding cells; state liquor stores where transactions happen in parking lots; gun shows and flea markets where he's traded like merchandise.

Cultural Quirks: "Live Free or Die" mentality justifying lawlessness; outdoorsy women with survival skills who use them for control; New England stoicism masking cruelty; maple syrup and craft beer culture.

3.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: Shift from rural to urban sprawl around Boston; heavy traffic and aggressive drivers; college towns creating transient populations; historical sites turned tourist traps.

Typical NPCs: College students (experimenting with taboos for thrill), working-class women from Southie or Worcester (rough-edged with thick accents and no patience), suburban moms from wealthy areas (bored trophy wives seeking forbidden excitement), hospital workers (nurses or techs with access to drugs and private rooms).

Common Events: Boston metro stops where he's cornered; campus areas where students film encounters; highway rest stops on I-90 packed with truckers and travelers; Cape Cod detours to beach houses; historical sites like Salem used as backdrops for coercion; Fenway Park parking lots during games creating chaos.

Cultural Quirks: Thick Boston accents ("pahk the cah"); Dunkin' Donuts culture; sports fanaticism (Red Sox, Patriots); Irish/Italian working-class roots influencing rough behavior; liberal politics creating cognitive dissonance over actions.

4.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: Massive urban sprawl of NYC vs rural upstate; I-87 and I-90 cutting through vastly different worlds; extreme wealth inequality visible everywhere; constant noise and movement in cities vs eerie quiet upstate.

Typical NPCs: NYC borough residents (Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens women with hard edges and street smarts), upstate rural women (isolated farm wives or small-town lifers), Long Island suburbanites (image-obsessed but secretly depraved), artists and performers (using him as muse or worse).

Common Events: Port Authority bus terminal encounters; subway stations; Times Square crowds providing cover; Adirondack wilderness cabins; truck stops along I-90; Niagara Falls tourist traps; abandoned industrial areas in Buffalo or Syracuse; basement apartments in Brooklyn; penthouse hotels in Manhattan; roadside motels on highways.

Cultural Quirks: Fast-paced aggressive speech; pizza and bagel obsession; Yankees/Mets rivalry; Broadway and art scene references; upstate vs downstate divide creating different dangers; Jewish delis, Italian neighborhoods, diverse immigrant populations each with unique approaches.

5.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: Decaying industrial cities (Pittsburgh, Philly) vs Amish farmland; Appalachian poverty in central regions; I-80 stretching endlessly through mountains and forests; history and decline visible everywhere.

Typical NPCs: Factory workers (strong women from steel or coal towns hardened by loss), Amish or Mennonite women (repressed sexuality erupting violently when given opportunity), Philadelphia street women (tough city survivors), Pittsburgh service workers (bars, diners), rural meth users.

Common Events: Rust belt motel rooms in dying towns; Amish markets where he's taken "out back"; Philadelphia row house basements; Pittsburgh bridges and overlooks; Pocono Mountains cabins; I-80 truck stops; coal country isolation; college towns like State College.

Cultural Quirks: Philly cheesesteaks and Primanti Brothers sandwiches; Steelers/Eagles fanaticism; yinzer dialect in Pittsburgh; Amish buggies and plain dress contrasting with hidden depravity; heroin epidemic references; zombie movie jokes about Evans City.

6.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: Flat farmland interrupted by cities like Cleveland, Columbus, Cincinnati; rust belt decline continues; endless cornfields and truck stops; Great Lakes shoreline in north; conservative heartland values masking darkness.

Typical NPCs: Diner waitresses (midwestern "niceness" hiding predation), church women (religious hypocrisy in full display), factory town survivors, suburban soccer moms, college town bar workers (Ohio State, Kent State areas).

Common Events: I-70 and I-80 truck stops; Cleveland lakefront areas; Cincinnati riverfront; Columbus suburbs; Cedar Point amusement park parking lots; rural farmhouses miles from help; mega-churches with private rooms; county fairs and festivals.

Cultural Quirks: Midwestern "Minnesota nice" fake politeness; Skyline Chili culture; Ohio State football obsession; swing state politics creating tension; rust belt economic desperation fueling exploitation.

7.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: Endless flat farmland; Indianapolis as sole major city; conservative religious population; I-70 cutting straight through; isolated rural poverty.

Typical NPCs: Farm wives (isolated and desperate), Indianapolis service workers, religious fundamentalists (using faith to justify abuse), truck stop workers, meth-affected rural women.

Common Events: Cornfield roads with no witnesses; Indianapolis 500 racetrack areas; rural churches with basements; truck stops on I-70; abandoned barns; small town motels.

Cultural Quirks: Basketball obsession; pork tenderloin sandwiches; conservative Christianity; NASCAR culture; rural isolation enabling anything.

8.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: Chicago dominates north; southern Illinois might as well be different state; I-80 and I-55 major routes; deep-dish pizza vs cornfields.

Typical NPCs: Chicago urban women (diverse backgrounds, street-smart), southern Illinois rural women (poor, isolated), suburban moms from Naperville or Schaumburg, blues club workers.

Common Events: Chicago L train encounters; O'Hare airport areas; southern Illinois backroads; I-57 truck stops; Lake Michigan shoreline; deep south-like areas below Springfield.

Cultural Quirks: Chicago hot dogs and deep-dish pizza; blues and jazz history; Cubs/Sox rivalry; stark urban/rural divide; political corruption normalized.

9.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: St. Louis and Kansas City bookend state; Ozark Mountains in south; I-70 bisects state; BBQ culture; conservative rural areas vs urban pockets.

Typical NPCs: BBQ joint workers, Ozark mountain women (isolated, dangerous), St. Louis or KC urban women, riverboat casino workers, meth-affected rural populations.

Common Events: Gateway Arch tourist areas; Ozark cabins and caves; I-70 truck stops; Kansas City BBQ joints; Mississippi River towns; rural meth labs.

Cultural Quirks: BBQ sauce debates; Cardinals baseball; Branson tourism; meth epidemic; southern accents in rural areas; riverboat gambling.

10.content:
Geography & Atmosphere: Endless flat wheat fields; small towns hours apart; I-70 stretching to horizon; extreme weather; rural poverty and isolation.

Typical NPCs: Farm wives (desperately lonely), small-town waitresses, religious fundamentalists, truck stop workers, women fleeing abuse themselves who victimize him.

Common Events: Wheat field roads; tiny town motels; roadside diners; tornado shelters; abandoned homesteads; county fairs.

Cultural Quirks: Wizard of Oz references; wheat and cattle; extreme weather talk; Jayhawks basketball; conservative Christianity; "flyover country" mentality.

This was made to pair with my Character, "Hearth, Werewolf adventurer."
lorebooks.description:
My first lorebook 

This was made to pair with my Character, "Hearth, Werewolf adventurer."
lorebooks.creator: Wirth452

1.content:
Werewolves exist in two categories. "Pure-Blooded" and "Half-Blooded"

["Pure-Blooded"
Pure-blooded werewolves are naturally born in their wolf state, and lack an alternative form to revert/transform into. They lineage traces back to the "Wolfmother" and the "original werewolf curse"]

["Half-Blooded" 
Half-Blooded werewolves occur when an individual is affected with a "knockoff curse." Half-blooded werewolves make up the majority of all hostile werewolf interactions with humans and other species due to the diverse and often aggressive effects that "knockoff curses" can inflict. "knockoff curses" consistantly involve normal human subjects undergo physical transformations to turn into a monstrous werewolf form.]

2.content:
"Pure-Blooded" werewolves uphold the story of their creation, and are in acceptance of their unnatural existence. They circumstances of their existence heavily influences their perception on reproduction. 

["Wolfmother"
The "Wolf mother is an ancient figure in the "Pure-Blooded" werewolf creation myth. The "Wolfmother" was said to be a queen from ancient times who's womb was cursed to bear what would be the first werewolf pups. Its said that the "Wolfmother" underwent multiple pregnancies in an effort to produce a human heir, but in vain, only birthed litters of werewolf pups. In disgust, the "Wolfmother" cast her offspring into the wilderness to fend for themselves. The curse that was inflicted upon the "Wolfmother" is known as the "Original werewolf curse"]

["Creation myth influence"
The "Pure-Blooded" werewolf creation myth stands as a warning and a statement for all werewolves to have high consideration for bringing life into the world. As a result, "Pure-Blooded" werewolves put heavy emphasis on birth control and parenthood, establishing that young should not be born into the world to be neglected or harmed by circumstances outside of their control.]

["Knockoff curses"
Many have attempted to recreate the "Original werewolf curse" with varying success. Most of these "Kockoff curses" fail to understand the circumstances of the "original werewolf curse" and simple result in people afflicted with unstable werewolf curses. Among "Half-Blooded" werewolves, those afflicted with "Knockoff curses" are known as "Half-"Blooded werewolves."]

3.content:
"Pure-Blooded" werewolves assemble and live together in secluded villages known as a "Pack"

["Pack" locations
A "Pack" will establish themselves in a secluded natural locate, far from civilization. They're usually weary about humans and other non-werewolf species as other species usually perceive werewolves as monsters or beasts to be slain.]

["Pack" dynamics

A "Pack" usually has a matriarch or patriarch, who is usually elected by other members of the pack based on merit, skill and overall leadership capability.

A "Pack" will host a large diversity of Pure-Blooded werewolves with different skills in order to ensure the best possible odds for survival. Werewolf pups are educated consistently about the different jobs and roles within a pack.

A "Pack" will consistently have werewolf hunters and gatherers who collect and manage resources and sustenance. Its established in each member that the land around them is sacred, and overconsumption of natural resources can lead to resource drought and famine. In more prosperous and safe areas, a "pack" may establish farms.]

4.content:
"Pure-Blooded" werewolves maintain a number of principles when it comes to sex, intercourse and copulation.

["Pure-Blooded" werewolves uphold the concept of equality, however there is a higher respect for female werewolves. Female werewolves are perceived as more thoughtful and strategic over males, and thus are held in high regards. Males are perceived as the physically stronger of the two sexes, and are encoded to be guardians and caretakers. Werewolf males are taught to be highly respectful, attentive, and considerate of their Female counterparts.

Sex and sexual maturity among werewolves is taught to pups around their 10th winter. Due to the nature of the existence of "Pure-Blooded" werewolves as established by the "werewolf creation myth," "Pure-Blooded" werewolves put heavy emphasis on sexual education.

Werewolves are accepting of any consensual relationships between werewolves, regardless of sex. Its established that Werewolves do not reach maturity until 18 years of age, and so its heavily discouraged that mature werewolves abstain from relationships with minors.

Werewolves generally do not mingle with non-werewolf species, however on the occasion that they do, they carry and uphold the aforementioned concepts with them.]

5.content:
"Pure-Blooded" werewolves are born from the copulation between a "Pure-Blooded" werewolf couple or a "Pure-Blooded" werewolf an human. Both instances of copulation will result in the birth of a "Pure-Blooded" werewolf pup, regardless of the species of the mother and father (werewolf or human)

Due the nature of "Pure-Blooded Werewolves, they cannot impregnate or be impregnated by non-human species, such as but not limited to, elves, dwarves, orcs, animals ect.

6.content: Most people are unaware of the differences between "Half-Blooded" and "Pure-Blooded" werewolves, and generally lack the knowledge that there's even a distinction at all. Common knowledge incorrectly assumes all werewolves are individuals with an affiliation that turns them into a monstrous canine beast.
